You don't roll the dice in Kasta you discard them, this makes the game play similar to games like Rummy, Dominoes and Uno the exception being that in Kasta there is no hidden information.

136603.name: KISS: Psycho Circus – The Nightmare Child
136603.description:
KISS: Psycho Circus - The Nightmare Child is a first person shooter computer game developed by Third Law Interactive and published by Gathering of Developers for the PC in August 2000. It was also released later that year for the Dreamcast (using Windows CE) following a port by Tremor Entertainment. The game is based on Todd McFarlane's KISS: Psycho Circus series of comic books, themselves inspired by the rock band KISS. KISS: Psycho Circus was the first game to be developed by Third Law Interactive, themselves having recently formed in December 1998 after a widely publicized mass walkout from Ion Storm. Versions for the PlayStation and the Game Boy Color were planned, but were later canceled. The PC version of the game was done on the an enhanced version of the Lithtech engine, licensed from Monolith Productions.

The game's story revolves around a KISS tribute band, who suddenly receive superhuman powers.

Source: Wikipedia, "Kiss: Psycho Circus: The Nightmare Child", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

136604.name: Painkiller: Recurring Evil
136604.description:
Painkiller: Recurring Evil is an add-on featuring 5 new levels with about 4000 enemies. It was released digitally on February 29, 2012 by Nordic Games GmbH via Steam, and developed by Med-Art and Eggtooth.

It continues the story of Resurrection and serves as a side story for Redemption. Bill Sherman becomes the ruler of Purgatory, blessed with power of the Sword of Seraphim. However, the fallen angel Samael (now wingless after his defeat at the hands of Belial in Overdose), who took the power of Hell from Eve, steals Bill's sword and sends him to Purgatory's unexplored locations, forcing the fight to start again.

Source: Wikipedia, "Painkiller (video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

136605.name: Cauldron (Issue 0 - Dec 2012)
136605.description:
From the Table of Contents -

Introduction: Coming to a Boil
Feature: Heroes & Other Worlds Basic Rules
Adventurers Assemble! Sample Characters
Filthy Lucre: Blood Harvest solo adventure
Beliefs & Believers: Veneration of the Ancients
Faculties & Staff: Grimoire of Shadows
Tooth & Claw: Frost Walker
Adventure: Rise of the Wickerman
Clone Conversion: Retro-Clone to Heroes & Other Worlds
Portals to Other Worlds: List of Links

136606.description:
Sergeants Miniatures Game: Red Devils is a totally innovative but proven system, with the game’s engine run by impulse cards managing four broad, basic functions—and randomizing the order—while each player manages a hand of cards constructed by the talents and foibles of the troops under his or her command.

Unlike many "miniatures" games where you buy the rules and then have to start shopping and painting, SMG: Red Devils is a complete game out of the box. You’ll find 20mm, pre-painted miniatures, plenty of thick, two-sided, colorful mapboard tiles which can be assembled in various ways, easy rules, scenarios, player aids... everything you need to get started on your missions and having fun fast.
136606.name: Sergeants Miniatures Game: Red Devils

136608.name: Mutton
136608.description:
User Summary

Between 27 sheep, there are three hidden wolves. The aim of one, is to keep hidden wolves to go eating the sheep. The aim of his rival, is to find the wolves and shoot as soon as possible. With deduction and bluff, players should start building their strategies.

You can play against AI as Farmer or as Wolf, even with another player from anywhere in the world!

Creators of the board game are Stephen Tavener and Cameron Browne"

136609.name: Jenga BOOM
136609.description: A spin-off of the popular Jenga dexterity game, Jenga BOOM's gameplay remains largely the same as its forebear, with one big twist: the tower of wooden blocks rests upon a plastic "bomb" platform. Before the game starts, players pull a string on the side to start the ticking timer. Each turn, a player must press the "play" button to restart the timer and then a "stop" button once he's finished his turn. When the timer runs out, the platform drops, leveling the tower, and the player whose turn it is loses.

136610.name: Imazine (Issue 21 - Autumn 1994)
136610.description:
Table of Contents
Editorial ..............................1
The Masque of God ......................2
In Praise of Plagiarism ................4
Imazine Welcomes Careful Contributors ..6
State of Play: The Water Margin ........7

136611.name: The Fall of Elturgard
136611.description:
From the first page of the PDF:

Following the discovery of corruption among the paladins of the Order of Torm and a deadly plague born of Bhaal that nearly destroyed Scornubel, Everyn Cadwy has brought together the leaders of the various Elturgardan factions for a summit to address the blight at the heart of the region. You have been asked by your allies to help represent one of these factions in order to negotiate the best possible alliance. Your task is nothing more and nothing less than to save Elturgard. A two-round continuous-play Living Forgotten Realms adventure set in Elturgard for characters of the Heroic tier (levels 1-10). This adventure completes the story arc that includes ELTU4-1, ELTU4-2, and ELTU4-3. We recommend that you play all these adventures in order with the same character if possible.

136623.name: Il gioco dell'emozione
136623.description:
Objective of the game is to create and put on air two advertising campaigns for famous brands.
Each player represents an advertising agency that should develop the advertising campaigns. Each campaign is made by several elements, that should be collected by moving on the board with a dice roll. The elements are: the testimonial of the campaigns, the media that will publish the advertising, various agency figures needed to develop the advertising (varying according to the brief).
The board represents a skyline of a modern city. The game start in the month of September and ends in August.
The winner is the player that first presents two successful advertising campaigns.

The game has been produced and distributed by the Gruppo Essevi agency, as a gift for its customers for Christmas 1990.

136625.name: Gazillionaire
136625.description:
Gazillionaire is the award-winning business simulation game where you buy low and sell high. You get to run your own trading company, cut deals, corner the market, and outwit your competitors. Your goal is to build a business empire. See if you have what it takes to become a true Gazillionaire!

Source: The Publisher Website.

136627.description: You can now play MDA with a fifth hero class, the Beastmaster. Beastmasters are aided by their animal companions, the swift falcon, the nimble ferrets, the deadly wolf and the mighty bear.
136627.name: Mini Dungeon Adventures: Beast Master

136629.name: Pega Ladrão
136629.description:
From the box:

"Astúcia e malícia num jogo de polícia e ladrão!"

Pega Ladrão is a brazilian game from the early 80's with a Cops and Robbers theme, where players take turns trying to scoring points. It was published by Grow and there's no info on a re-release of it.

The game starts with the "Jail" card on the table. The Cop and the Robber player take turns, placing cards on the table, that shows a maze of streets. The Robber player must lay his cards in a way to form a free passageway as far as the jail as possible, while the Cop player must put him on a dead end.

136630.name: Dimension Six
136630.description:
A unique strategy game for two to four players. The objective is to get two of your hexagons from your corner into each of the opponents’ corner. The hexagons are moved by playing one of 13 cards you are dealt. The trick is to choose which card to use at the right time. The one who does will win. by cards with 13 cards dealt to each player. Players decide which card to use each turn. Every player has a chance of winning the game right up until the end.

It’ll make you think!

136631.description:
The game board shows a map of New Yorc. Players roll a die and move through the city, trying to reach the famous sites (especially those two whose cards they drew at the beginning and which are marked). Additionally, taxis, buses and the tube can be used to get around more quickly, but they have to be paid for in travel chips. When a player reaches a site, s/he is asked a question. If answering correctly, the site card can be discarded and a new travel chip is drawn. When reaching an unmarked site, they can earn a new site card (if that belongs to someone else, it can be "stolen").
When a player can reach both sites they drew at the beginning and gain two more site cards and return to their starting location, s/he wins the game.

Questions come in two difficulty levels, as the game is designed for language learning. So the difficulty does not refer to the knowledge needed to answer the question, but to the English speaking ability.
136631.name: A Weekend in New York

136632.name: Bucoli Sourcebook
136632.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Bucoli are a brotherhood of cut-throat, vicious, tenacious vampires. Beginning each night in prayer, dedicating their undead lives to their gods, the Bucoli are powerbrokers in the vampiric underworld. Similar to the Eligiere in that they crave power, Bucoli are the darker counterparts. If Eligiere were light, Bucoli are dark.

When choosing from the mortal world, Bucoli take the most cold, calculating, money-loving SOBs in the city. Lawyers, doctors, stockbrokers and those willing to do whatever it takes to get the job done are welcomed into the House.

Wielding the powerful Dark Gift of Spiritus, Bucoli are inducted into an undead fraternal organization where each member begins as a recruit and has his/her sponsor bring them to The Assembly. Upon going through the Rites, a member may be inducted, embracing their new life, Turned in a ceremony and blessed by the House priest. After this moment the new member must cut throats and backstab to get to the top as he's knocked to the bottom of the status-quo. Given his newfound powers, the Liberi must adhere to not only the Blood Laws, but the laws of his House in order to survive. Only those who prove themselves may learn the secrets of Sorcery and possess the tools to truly manipulate the masses. Through faith and fire a Bucoli is tested and through this faith they are made whole in front of the whole assembly. Do you have what it takes to step into the shoes of a Bucoli? Can you climb to the top and make a name for yourself? Find out how dark the world around you can be as you play a Bucoli.

136633.name: Lilliana Sourcebook
136633.description:
From publisher blurb:

Lilliana. Sexual hedonists, sex-pots, beautiful and seductive sirens, succubi, the list goes on and one to describe one of death’s most beautifully created ladies. Most Lilliana have an ethical following that argues that pleasure is the only intrinsic good -that only things that are pleasurable are good. This ethical code is used as justification for their actions weighing things as what will bring them the most pleasure or pain. To put it plain, the Lilliana try to maximize their pleasure in all things to get the most out of it.

In living a hedonistic life, the Lilliana can expect to seek out pleasures in order to attain a state of tranquility and freedom from fear as well as an absence of pain though their knowledge of the workings of the world and our desires. The combination and fulfillment of these? Happiness and bliss. Lilliana teach their trinity of knowledge, friendship and living a life in pursuit of pleasure, however, there are limits that each Maker bestows upon their Liberi. By having too much sex, there is the natural fear that one could become dissatisfied with their partner, by overeating, one could lose a taste for their food. Heeding these warnings, the Lilliana teach that living a life in pursuit of pleasure is only good with a balance in it.

136634.name: Alien Shooter 2: Reloaded
136634.description:
Alien Shooter 2 - Reloaded is a modified version of the Alien Shooter 2 game. We started working on it right after release of AS2, taking into account the players' wishes. Well, here's the list of what we've done:
1. Size of the full version installation file was reduced to 300 Mb, compared to 1Gb of the original Alien Shooter 2. Large installation file prevented users with slow connection from buying and downloading the game.
2. Player upgrade parameters simplified. Now you don't need to develop separate skills for each weapon type, so you'll be able to complete the game using all the weapon types featured in it.
3. Two new missions added. Now the game features 17 full levels.
4. New individual shooting mode added - Gun Stand. You will use powerful military equipment to eliminate advancing enemy troops. As the game goes on, you will upgrade your weapon in different ways, and the right choice will let you win the battle!

Source: The Publisher Website.

136635.name: Samaritan
136635.description:
From publisher blurb:

Introducing the SAMARITAN! The newest member of the heroic WGU community!!

The latest hero is also the youngest WGU hero to date! Meet 5-yr old Sawyer DeBause, who's life, through a series of circumstances, gets turned upside-down and inside-out by the discovery of a powerful alien amulet that embues him with incredible powers...and an adult physique!

136636.name: Gravitas
136636.description:
From publisher blurb:

Meet GRAVITAS!! Never-before-available in any format! The newest release from Les Supérieurs corner in the WatchGuard Universe! Gravitas is the hot, powerful, focused member of the team from Canada and a force to be reckoned with! As potent as she is lovely, Gravitas is the latest addition to the WatchGuard Universe from North of the Border...! Get her today!

136637.name: Intrepid
136637.description:
From publisher blurb:

And now introducing, INTREPID!
As fast as she is gorgeous, as famous as she is blonde, meet our starlet speedster as she makes her way into her own WatchGuard Solo project! One of the founding members of WatchGuard, Intrepid's kinetic energy-based powers lend her a variety of abilities, most of which present themselves as speed-related powers. Fun-loving, tomboy-ish (under all that pretty), and eager to prove she's more than just a TV heroine, Intrepid is ready to join your adventures!

136638.name: Kindle
136638.description:
From publisher blurb:

Meet KINDLE, the hot-headed, hot-bodied villainess!

As angry & bitter as she is powerful, Kindle is also fairly unskilled in her abilities which itself presents some challenges in defense against her. Unpredictable and explosive are definite descriptors for this fiery lass...! Handle her with care!

136639.name: Mazer
136639.description:
From publisher blurb:

Here's MAZER, potentially the most POWERFUL member of the WatchGuard!

WatchGuard's resident energy generator/controller is here, raw, untrained, and somewhat unfocused, Mazer has a ton of loaded potential... and he's just getting started. Intelligent, funny, fun-loving, and never too serious, Mazer lightens up the adventure just by his mere presence. In more ways than one... Enjoy!

136640.name: Braindamage
136640.description:
From publisher blurb:

BRAINDAMAGE comin' atcha!!! The psychotic, disturbed villain from the *original* WatchGuard Sourcebook is now available as a WG Solo release! UPDATED!

136641.name: Briton
136641.description:
From publisher blurb:

Meet BRITON!! Never-before-available in any format! The newest release from Les Supérieurs corner in the WatchGuard Universe! Briton is on loan to the Canadian military from the newly-formed, British government unit MI-7, Briton works alongside Les Supérieurs in an honorary fashion, helping to use his expertise to strengthen the C.O.R.E. facility training, development internal practices, and more! As the United Kingdom's greatest metahuman hero, Briton is powerful enough to take on any adventure alone, or alongside your country's favorite heroes!

136642.name: Cardinal
136642.description:
From publisher blurb:

Meet Cardinal, the genius engineer by day, heroic vigilante by night!

Ok, so he fights crime in the daylight as well, but his job as an engineer for Meridian Enterprises keeps him quite busy most daytime hours -- in the nighttime, Cardinal seeks to protect the innocent, defend the defenseless, and prove to the world the corruption residing inside his own employer's organization... perhaps even clear up to the main man himself, the starling darling of Summit City: Dr. Erick Schuster!

136643.name: Black Bow
136643.description:
From publisher blurb:

Meet BLACK BOW, villainous archer and carefree hitman!

Banished from sports for being metahuman, Kellen Carson opted to take his anger & bitterness into making a name for himself in crime. Now, as Black Bow, he's teamed with a gang of metahumans ready to take over Summit City and destroy the WatchGuard!

136644.name: Europe Racing
136644.description:
game cover

Race at 21 tracks in 10 European cities.

136645.name: Amp
136645.description:
From publisher blurb:

Prepare to get AMPped!! This villain originally appeared in the WatchGuard Sourcebook, and is now appearing as a WG Solo for the first time. Engineer-turned-dynamo, father-turned-enforcer, AMP is ready to tackle anyone who gets in his way!

136646.name: Magnum
136646.description:
From publisher blurb:

MAGNUM!

Who hits like a freight train, can withstand pretty much anything you can throw at him and walk away with the stolen cash? Magnum, that's who! This week's issue focuses on the Indestructible Outlaw himself. Get it before he gets you!

136647.name: Bathory
136647.description:
From publisher blurb:

BATHORY!

Vampires are a monster that everyone knows, right? Well, maybe not all vampires. Meet Bathory, former nobility turned immortal blood countess and rock star. Each issue of Acts of Villainy: Solo contain a write-up for one villain, including stats and background.

136648.name: Coldheart
136648.description:
From publisher blurb:

COLDHEART!

Winter Villains (3 of 4). Cold, calculating and a killer. All terms to define Coldheart, an assassin and thief that can give any hero a chilling reception. Each issue of Acts of Villainy: Solo contain a write-up for one villain, including stats and background.

136649.name: Ferrous
136649.description:
From publisher blurb:

FERROUS!

A master of magnetic force, Ferrous is what happens when power falls into the wrong hands. Not willing to stop at just simple goals, the magnetic mastermind has all of the Earth in his sites. Each issue of Acts of Villainy: Solo contain a write-up for one villain, including stats and background.

136650.name: Light Lord
136650.description:
From publisher blurb:

LIGHT LORD!

The self-proclaimed Lord of Light. While some would use such power for the benefit of mankind, Light Lord is only interested in showing the world he will be mocked no longer. Each issue of Acts of Villainy: Solo contain a write-up for one villain, including stats and background.

136651.name: Windchill
136651.description:
From publisher blurb:

WINDCHILL!

Winter Villains (1 of 4). Like a winter storm Windchill strikes! Relentless, deadly and powerful, she can bring destruction upon any that oppose her. Each issue of Acts of Villainy: Solo contain a write-up for one villain, including stats and background.

136652.name: Mustang
136652.description:
From publisher blurb:

MUSTANG!

What happens when you combine a super-soldier with a super speedster? Mustang happens. Quick to think and act, this sinister speedster is ready to take down any heroes he meets.

136653.name: Silverfang
136653.description:
From publisher blurb:

SILVERFANG!

A feral assassin, deadly with or without his razor sharp claws. Silverfang is a unrelenting hunter, bound by a contract to take out his mark, or to finish tasks no other can. Each issue of Acts of Villainy: Solo contain a write-up for one villain, including stats and background.

136654.name: Snowclone
136654.description:
From publisher blurb:

SNOWCLONE!

Winter Villains (2 of 4). Ever need a team of villains to do a bank heist or to steal some diamonds? Meet Snowclone, the one man supervillain team. With his ice powers, he can stop any hero cold! Each issue of Acts of Villainy: Solo contain a write-up for one villain, including stats and background.

136655.name: Sportica
136655.description:
From publisher blurb:

SPORTICA!!

With her array of sports-equipment-turned-weapons, athlete-turned-villain Sportica is sure to be a workout for your heroes! Each issue of Acts of Villainy: Solo contain a write-up for one villain, including stats and background.

136656.name: Tangleweb
136656.description:
From publisher blurb:

TANGLEWEB!

Science gone wrong. It's a staple in comic books. How many times has an experiment needed the heroes to swoop in and save the day? Meet Tangleweb, a brilliant scientist corrupted by his own talents and re-made into a spider-like monster. Each issue of Acts of Villainy: Solo contain a write-up for one villain, including stats and background.

136657.name: The Harvester
136657.description:
From publisher blurb:

HARVESTER!

Harken back to the horror movies of the '80s with this supernatural stalker that's ready to confront your heroes. Meet Harvester, a monstrous villain that is almost unstoppable and harvests souls for his own devious needs. Each issue of Acts of Villainy: Solo contain a write-up for one villain, including stats and background.

136658.name: The Winter King
136658.description:
From publisher blurb:

THE WINTER KING!

Winter Villains (4 of 4): We close out our winter-themed villains with The Winter King! A colossus from an ancient age, this icy giant destroys all with its wintery touch!

136660.name: Wisdom from the Wastelands (Issue 6 - Mar 7, 2012)
136660.description:
From publisher blurb:

Issue #6: Factions

Social-political groups were one element that brought a lot of fun into the original old school science-fantasy games. This issue presents several factions or alliances Mutant Lords can easily incorporate into their existing campaigns. There are no rules covering these organizations, and decisions regarding joining/recruitment, membership benefits, NPCs, group size, and home base locations are left up to the fertile imaginations of individual MLs. That said, however, each faction has a general outlook on life and some broad goals.

136662.name: Kingdom Hearts Re:coded
136662.description:
Back of the Box

When a mysterious message appears in Jiminy Cricket's journal, King Mickey calls on Sora to spring into action. Play as the beloved Keyblade wielder and fight through glitch-infested worlds to restore order.

136663.name: Scribble Hero
136663.description:
Get drawn into an action-packed world when you join the heroic doodle, Sketch, in a battle to save your notebook from an army of sinister scribbles and nasty doodles!

Source: The Publisher Website.

136664.name: Euro Truck Simulator 2
videogameexpansion: Euro Truck Simulator 2 - Vive la France!
videogamehonor: 2013 Global Game Awards Best Simulation Game of the Year Nominee
2016 Steam Awards I Thought This Game Was Cool Before It Won An Award Winner
2016 Steam Awards Sit Back and Relax Winner
136664.description:
Travel across Europe as king of the road, a trucker who delivers important cargo across impressive distances! With dozens of cities to explore from the UK, Belgium, Germany, Italy, the Netherlands, Poland, and many more, your endurance, skill and speed will all be pushed to their limits. If you’ve got what it takes to be part of an elite trucking force, get behind the wheel and prove it!

Source: The Game Website.

136665.name: Vampire: Undeath Player's Guide
136665.description:
From Introduction:

IMAGINE a world with terrible monsters, creatures of legends that come from an ancient time to walk among us, hiding from the masses.

Imagine the world we all know, the world around us. The same cities, streets and businesses. The same music, movies and past times. The difference between the game world and the real world is very simple. There are monsters in the game world. Vampires have influenced the world since ancient times, from being ancient gods worshipped by the masses to hidden masters of influence. In this game you will take on the persona of a vampire character and learn how to play that character in our game world, the world of Damnation.

So just how do you use this book? Think of the Player’s Guide as a way to help broaden your skills and explore areas you hadn’t thought of before. Odds are you have some experience with roleplaying which can be a great thing. This game is designed to be everything you want it to be because you make it great.
We’ve taken old myths, stories and legends and blended them with pop culture to reimagine the horror rpg. Imagine taking your character from a mortal being Turned on his/her journey through undeath. Imagine their experiences first hand as you play your character and experience the world of the game.

We hope you’re ready. This book contains everything you need to play a vampire character and explores everything you need to make a great, well-rounded character.

136666.name: Wisdom from the Wastelands (Issue 7 - Mar 15, 2012)
rpgissuearticle: Additional Planar Creatures and New Mutations
136666.description:
From publisher blurb:

Issue #7: Planar Creatures & Concepts

One mutation that could greatly influence a campaign setting and its population is plane shift. Once a planar gate is opened, anything that comes through will affect the Mutant Future world. New arrivals could include seeds, spores, eggs, creatures, diseases, energy, technology, or even changes in the laws of physics. This issue provides a few example creatures, mutations, and energies from alternate realities.

136667.name: Wisdom from the Wastelands (Issue 8 - Mar 22, 2012)
136667.description:
From publisher blurb:

Issue #8: Diseases & Medical Options

During the final wars that destroyed the Ancients’ civilization, some of the most horrifying weapons unleashed were terrible biological diseases and plagues. Such diseases were great equalizers, their viruses and bacteria striking down unlucky victims regardless of wealth, ethnicity, or homeland.

Although the Mutant Future core book touches on optional rules regarding diseases and their effects, this issue will provide Mutant Lords with a wider range of possibilities. These additions expand the Constitution Table, include healing rates and negative hit points, and provide simple but effective rules covering mutants using the Ancients’ drugs and medical equipment. Several new types of disease — both infectious and mutagenic — are also introduced, as well as detailed rules covering symptoms and a new type of saving throw. In short, everything a ML needs to make player characters’ lives that much more “interesting.”

136668.name: Wisdom from the Wastelands (Issue 9 - Mar 29, 2012)
rpgissuearticle: More New Weapons and New Condition
136668.description:
From publisher blurb:

Issue #9: High-Tech Weapons 2

The second installment of our weapon-themed series, this issue picks up where Wisdom from the Wastelands Issue #3:High-Tech Weapons left off and presents more than a half-dozen new sorts of combat systems for both players’ and Mutant Lords’ enjoyment! Armaments covered include Antimatter Bombs, Bead Guns, Desiccators, EMP Weapons, Grenade Launchers, Plasma Projectors, and Screamers, along with one new associated condition.

136669.name: Wisdom from the Wastelands (Issue 10 - Apr 4, 2012)
136669.description:
From publisher blurb:

Issue #10: Monsters That Improve with Age 2

The age chart is a powerful tool for Mutant Lords who want to scale monster encounters with the powers and artifacts of the player characters. These charts describe how a creature’s characteristics change over its lifespan, using three columns: the age of the creature, its hit dice, and notes. Notes might include damage, mutations, drawbacks, or anything else that affects the creature in and out of combat.

Though the first Age Charts article (Wisdom from the Wastelands, issue #2) introduced the basic idea and structure, there are still plenty of other possibilities that go far beyond that starting point. This issue presents example charts for creatures that weaken during the last stages of life, giant creatures (kaiju), plants, and truly odd creatures that go through metamorphoses as they age.

136670.name: Temple Run: Brave
136670.description:
Disney Mobile Games launched on the App Store and Google Play, Temple Run: Brave. The new mobile game brings together the world of Disney•Pixar’s animated fantasy adventure Brave, with Imangi Studio’s Temple Run, for a new take on the hit 3D Endless Runner. In Temple Run: Brave, players join the movie’s heroine Merida and run, slide, jump, turn and shoot their way across the rugged landscape of mythical and mysterious Scotland.

Temple Run: Brave includes a host of new features, environments and characters exclusive to the game, including archery, where for the first time, players can tap targets to shoot a bulls eye and earn extra coins. Upon downloading Temple Run: Brave, players start running with $0.99 worth of coins for FREE—that’s 2500 coins for power-ups to outrun Mordu, the “demon bear,” and one of the chief villains of Brave.

COMPLETE LIST OF FEATURES:

New Features just for Temple Run: Brave:

• Introducing ARCHERY for the first time—tap targets to shoot a bulls eye and earn extra coins
• New, amazing visuals
• All new environments inspired by Disney•Pixar’s Brave and the wilds of Scotland
• Play as Merida from Disney•Pixar’s Brave
• Outrun Mordu, the demon bear from Disney•Pixar’s Brave, to earn running glory
• Bonus: download Temple Run: Brave and start running with $0.99 worth of coins for FREE

Also includes all the great features from Temple Run:

• Simple swipe-and-tilt controls that are easy to use and feel just right
• Level up your character and use crazy power-ups
• Game Center Leaderboards and Achievements to compete with your friends
• Endless play!

Temple Run: Brave is now available in the App Store for $0.99, or for download on the iPhone, iPod touch and iPad at http://bit.ly/LWZ4na.

Source: The Publisher Website.

136671.name: Aliens (1982/CP/M)
136671.description:
Aliens is a text-only clone of Space Invaders written for the CP/M operating system and made to be operated on the early Kaypro line of luggable computers.

Aliens was made within the limitations of Kaypro's early text-only computers. As a result, the aliens are made of letters and punctuation marks. Each level was given a name, displayed on top of the screen, such as Blood Bath and We Come in Peace.

Along with Star Trek, CatChum and Ladder, Aliens was one of the games that came with the software bundle of the early Kaypro computers.

Source: Wikipedia, "Aliens (Kaypro video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

rpg: Kobolds Ate My Baby! (Super Deluxx Edition)
136672.name: The Kobold: A Totally Expected Parody
136672.description:
User Summary:

The Kobold: A Totally Expected Parody Of A Beloved Book That Has Been Expanded Into A Trilogy Of Movies And Which Inexplicably Is Not Called There And Back Again (Part One: There) is a scenario for Kobolds Ate My Baby! taking players on an adventure to take some kobolds into a dragon's lair to steal some treasure. This story might sound very familiar, but we assure you it must just be coincidence.

136673.description: With this expansion you can play Travalgo with 5 or 6 players.
136673.name: Travalgo expansion

136674.name: Wisdom from the Wastelands (Issue 11 - Apr 12, 2012)
rpgissuearticle: Disarming, Limb Breakage or Loss, Firing Off-Hand, Firing Two Weapons, Rate of Fire
Injury, Modifiers to Hit Based on Size, Targeting Specific Body Locations, New Mutation
136674.description:
From publisher blurb:

Issue #11: Optional Combat Rules

In almost every roleplaying game, one of the biggest aspects is combat. Mutant Future is no exception, for, in many ways, combat could be considered one of the game’s most crucial aspects — next to mutations! In this spirit, here are several new optional rules a Mutant Lord can use to expand the combat possibilities in his or her game.

136675.name: Secret Party House of the Hill Giant Playboy
136675.description:
cover blurb:
Recommended for 4-6 characters of levels 4-8

This location-based scenario can be shunted into the referee’s campaign world in any hilly environment where giants might roam. Abbreviated game stats are given for the Swords & Wizardry Core rules, but can be adapted almost effortlessly to any old schoolish version of the original role playing game or ignored entirely for other games.

136676.name: Wisdom from the Wastelands (Issue 12 - Apr 26, 2012)
136676.description:
From publisher blurb:

Issue #12: Parasite Mutations/Transformations

Gut worms and intestinal bacteria, athlete’s foot fungus, toxoplasmosis protozoa, lycanthropy and Rage and vampire viruses. Whether biological fact or fictional terror, we are surrounded (and colonized) by parasitic lifeforms, some of which evolved to become a necessary part of us — while others affect our behavior, or become our nightmares. Parasite mutations were originally introduced in the Skirmisher Publishing LLC sourcebook Creatures of the Wastelands, but transformations are a new evolutionary step regarding the concept of symbionts bonding with hosts.

136677.name: Wisdom from the Wastelands (Issue 13 - May 10, 2012)
rpgissuearticle: Black Ray, Disease Diagnosis Companion, Genetic Damage Restorer, Harmonic Wand
Second Skin Suit, Stasis Generator, New Mutation (Genetic Replication)
136677.description:
From publisher blurb:

Issue #13: Medical Devices

Fantasy has spells and potions to heal injuries and resurrect the dead. Science fantasy has similar ways of curing what ails, but through technology. Although the Mutant Future core book describes a plethora of drugs, there were only a handful of medical devices available as technological treasure. This issue provides several new pieces of medical equipment that Mutant Lords can use as rewards, or characters can use to help survive another day.

136678.name: Wisdom from the Wastelands (Issue 14 - Jun 7, 2012)
rpgissuearticle: Brain Worm and Brain Lasher, Green Hide and Chicken Wolf
Shrimp and Giant Catfish, Water Mold and Glue Flower
Water Mold and Kelper, Water Mold and Null Plant
136678.description:
From publisher blurb:

Issue #14: AggregatesHaving another creature living on or inside your body is not a thought most would enjoy. Nor is the idea of having the same type of creature living inside a child and grandchild, joining generation after generation, until, over time, the two species gradually merge. But, this already happens. Humans and termites rely on intestinal bacteria to aid digestion, lichen are the synthesis of fungus and algae, and mycorrhizae are vital fungal symbionts in plant roots. Aggregates are composite creatures that result from the changes that develop from a host and a symbiont living as one. Rather than one individual host creature being infected by a single parasite, the aggregation process describes how two species merge over generations. Many aggregates do not survive the initial infection or bonding process, and it is only through large numbers of the host species and symbiont species combining that a new species eventually develops.

136679.name: Wisdom from the Wastelands (Issue 15 - Jun 30, 2012)
136679.description:
From publisher blurb:

Issue #15: Robots Part 1

Robots are just as important to Mutant Future as biological creatures. They can be antagonists, sources of information, or even slave labor. This is the first of four robot-themed issues, and presents eight new robots, as well as several new weapons and accessories. Only a few of the robots in this article have precise dimensions; the examples here are intended as types, not specific models. Mutant Lords are encouraged to customize their machines, and provide fine details to fit their settings.

136680.name: Wisdom from the Wastelands (Issue 16 - Sep 25, 2012)
rpgissuearticle: New Locomotion, New Accessories, New Weapon
136680.description:
From publisher blurb:

Issue #16: Robots Part 2

Robots are just as important to Mutant Future as biological creatures. They can be antagonists, sources of information, or even slave labor. In this second installment of four robot-themed issues there are eight new robots, as well as several new accessories, a new weapon, and a new form of locomotion. Only a few of the machines in this article have precise dimensions; the examples here are intended as types, not specific models. Mutant Lords are encouraged to customize their machines, and provide fine details to fit their settings.

136681.name: Wisdom from the Wastelands (Issue 17 - Oct 8, 2012)
rpgissuearticle: Advanced Pistols and Rifles, Armor, Encasing Military Armor
Power Sources, Grenades/Bombs/Explosives, Powered Gadgets and Gizmos, Foodstuffs
Primitive Firearms Ammunition, Primitive Firearms, Advanced Melee Weapons
136681.description:
From publisher blurb:

Issue #17: Artifact Conditions

Artifacts play a key role in Mutant Future. Like magical items in fantasy games, artifacts are treasures sought by adventuring parties that brave the mutant-infested ruins of the Ancients’ world. But often these treasures are in less than pristine condition due to factors such as age, neglect, or misuse.

136682.name: Wisdom from the Wastelands (Issue 18 - Oct 23, 2012)
rpgissuearticle: Training Robot, Transporter, Thief, Unreality Robot
Vacationing Home, New Accessories, New Weapons
136682.description:
From publisher blurb:

Issue #18: Robots Part 3

Robots are just as important to Mutant Future as biological creatures. They can be antagonists, sources of information, or even slave labor. In this third installment of four robot-themed issues there are eight new robots, as well as several new accessories, a new weapon, and a new form of locomotion. Only a few of the machines in this article have precise dimensions; the examples here are intended as types, not specific models. Mutant Lords are encouraged to customize their machines, and provide fine details to fit their settings.

136683.name: Wisdom from the Wastelands (Issue 19 - Nov 7, 2012)
rpgissuearticle: New Locomotion, New Manipulator, New Accessories
136683.description:
From publisher blurb:

Issue #19: Robots Part 4

Robots are just as important to Mutant Future as are biological creatures. They can be antagonists, sources of information, or even slave labor. In this fourth installment of author Derek Holland’s robot-themed issues there are new forms of locomotion, new accessories and weapons, and some additional rules.

136684.name: Wisdom from the Wastelands (Issue 20 - Nov 30, 2012)
136684.description:
From publisher blurb:

Issue #20: Mutation Modifiers

Just as a single change to a stock creature can result in a very different and distinct entity, mutation modifiers can expand the scope and variety of Mutant Future mutational powers, altering them slightly with bonuses or penalties. With little or no tweaking, these modifiers can also be applied to supernatural powers — such as spell-like abilities — used in games from other genres.

136685.name: Mystic Warriors Web Enhancement: The Forgotten
136685.description:
From Introduction:

In the world of Gothos, there are hidden sects and secret schools where the most powerful arts of war are learned. Great masters have studied the most ancient ways of fighting, passed down through the ages and tied to the powerful spirit of the races.

Presented in the Mystic Warriors sourcebook, is the rich history and techniques of these schools.

The great Pantheon calls them cults and fears them, chooses not to understand them, and in some secret way embraces them.

Unlike paladins, mystic warriors find power deep within themselves. It is their raw spirit that they draw upon to work the wonderfully complex combat moves that these fighters are legendary for. These warriors know how to reach deep inside themselves and call on their vitus, their spirit, their very ego, to do what they do. The schools have rigid ways and are as disciplined as any monk might be, in some cases more so. The warrior schools follow different creeds- many are good, some are
evil, and some focus purely on the art, not caring about the outside world at all.

What you have here in these pages is a single Mystic Warrior class. This special class, called The Forgotten will not be found in the Mystic Warriors sourcebook and is a preview to introduce you to our world and our new d20 supplement.

136686.name: Nightmares & Dreams Web Enhancement: Ecology of the Craw Man
136686.description:
From Introduction:

Since Crawmen are a type of humanoid crustacean, they have a thick carapace that expands as the Crawman grows. Crawmen do not grow gradually; they grow in stages. This is usually done several times during the first three years of the Crawmans life; it tapers off to once a year once it becomes an adult.

136687.name: Nightmares & Dreams Web Enhancement: The Crawling Terror
136687.description:
From Introduction:

This adventure is designed for 1st-3rd level characters, ideally suited for an introductory scenario that will challenge but not overpower fledgling PCs. GMs with parties either stronger or weaker should feel free to adjust the opposition to compensate. A tension-filled horror adventure, the focus is on setting a creepy mood rather than on simple combat, though there are certainly opportunities to test one’s sword arm.

136688.name: Of Places Most Foul Web Enhancement: Quick Locales
136688.description:
From Introduction:

Quick Locales are smaller examples of the plug-in Foul Locales you will find in our latest release titled Of Places Most Foul. These locations are meant to be plugged into the existing landscape of your campaign.

The Mansion of Blood
Brief Description: An old house sits behind rusting iron bars. Ivy covers the cracked brick walls and weeds poke up through the flagstones. The wraparound front porch is rotting, and a portion of its roof has collapsed in on itself. Broken windows leer down at those that pass by like the empty sockets of a huge skeletal head.
When night falls, eerie noises can be heard coming from the house, the sounds of cats being strangled and the groan of a rocking ship’s planks on a tempest tossed sea. Lights, like those from low burning lanterns or candles, pace the upper floors.

Terror of Taverns
Brief Description: A pleasant tavern set back from the hustle and bustle of the crowds, which is what most people would call “The Terror.” Unlike what its name implies, this tavern is a grand feasthall and parlor of ladies of the evening. All flavors of pleasure can be had at the Terror, whether it is flesh or food. Dancing girls and bards perform nightly, and the place is usually packed to the rafters with devoted patrons and the curious.

136689.name: The Pit of Loch-Durnan Revised
136689.description:
From Introduction:

The Pit of Loch-Durnan is an adventure compatible with the d20 system for 3 to 6 characters ranging from 2nd to 4th level. This adventure takes place in the small hamlet of Loch-Durnan, a town where two sons of the former mayor have fallen on dark ways, and have come to serve an imprisoned evil beast who seeks his release. The pair has sworn to assist the devil in his escape from the powerful crystal he is trapped in under a small mine called the Pit of Loch-Durnan. They can only do this by expanding the influence of the devil’s power.

This is a multi-part site-based adventure that should take the party up a level or two. It is designed with five 2nd-level characters in mind, but you can adjust it to accommodate three or four 3rd- or 4th-level characters, etc.

136690.name: Wisdom from the Wastelands (Issue 21 - Dec 22, 2012)
rpgissuearticle: Section II: Edging, Section III: Enhancements
136690.description:
From publisher blurb:

Issue #21: High-Tech Melee

Although most Ancients considered melee weapons like swords, axes, maces, spears, and even exotic ranged weapons such as bolas and shuriken to be archaic, some did practice the use of such weapons, and there were inevitably high-tech versions of them. This issue deals with these modern melee weapons, describes alternate methods of creating them, and introduces some new weapons.

136691.name: Wisdom from the Wastelands (Issue 23 - Jan 15, 2013)
136691.description:
From publisher blurb:

Issue #23: Sea Monsters

Despite much of the planet being covered by ocean, sea monsters have oddly been absent from all editions of the game that inspired Mutant Future. Such a vast area, in a variety of latitudes and conditions, provides a huge playground in which to design creatures. As a result, sea monsters could be anything from kaiju crabs to a form of bacteria that converts biological mass to various drugs and artifacts. This issue contains a few examples of such creatures.

136692.name: Quest for the Elf King
136692.description:
From the back of the book

The Elf has been kidnapped.

He waits, chained at the top of an enchanted tower, deep within the realm of the Darklord.

Your elvin [sic] bow and sword must match the cunning of the evil wizard, Hammet the Deceiver.

The fate of the Kingdom rests in your hands as you the...

Quest for the ELF KING

136693.name: BBC Master
136693.description:
The BBC Master was a home computer released by Acorn Computers in early 1986. It was designed and built for the British Broadcasting Corporation (BBC) and was the successor to the BBC Micro Model B. The Master 128 remained in production until 1993.

The Master featured several improvements on its predecessor. The systems had 128 kB RAM as standard, alleviating the shortage of available RAM which had amongst other things discouraged use of the best graphics modes in the original design, and had two cartridge slots mounted above the new numerical keypad. These were physically identical to those used by the Acorn Electron 'Plus 1' interface, but with enhanced electrical characteristics for some of the cartridge connector pins. Rather than the MOS Technology 6502 microprocessor used by the Model B it ran on the slightly improved 65SC12: the cost of this CPU compatibility with the Model B was that the address bus was still only 16 bits, meaning that only 64 kB could be directly addressed at any one time and the remaining memory had to be paged in as required.

Source: Wikipedia, "BBC Master", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

136694.name: Game Link Cable
136694.description:
The first generation Game Link Cable (model DMG-04) was released alongside the original Game Boy and has 'large' connectors on both ends. It can only be used to link two original Game Boys to play Game Link-compatible games, usually denoted by a "Game Link" logo (often read as "Game Boy Video Link") on the packaging and cartridge.

Source: Wikipedia, "Game Link Cable", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

136695.name: Game Boy Four Player Adapter
136695.description:
A select few Game Boy games, such as F-1 Race, supported multiplayer modes for up to four players, although this requires the use of up to three additional Game Link cables and the Game Boy Four Player Adapter (model DMG-07).

Source: Wikipedia, "Game Link Cable", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

136696.name: Game Link Cable Adaptor
136696.description:
After the release of the Game Boy Pocket, Nintendo started using a smaller Game Link connector (See 'Second Generation' below) and released an adaptor called the Game Link Cable Adaptor (model MGB-004) which could be used in conjunction with the original Game Link cable (model DMG-04) to allow an original Game Boy to connect to a Game Boy Pocket/Color.

Source: Wikipedia, "Game Link Cable", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

136697.name: Game Boy Pocket Game Link Cable
videogamehwversion: Game Boy Pocket Game Link Cable
136697.description:
The second generation Game Link Cables came in a few varieties, but each serves the same purpose. The first was called the Game Boy Pocket Game Link Cable (model MGB-008), and was designed to be used with the Game Boy Pocket. The MGB-008 was the only Game Link cable to be white in color, and may have only been released in Japan. The MGB-008 features the smaller second generation connectors on both ends, allowing two Game Boy Pockets to link.

Source: Wikipedia, "Game Link Cable", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

136698.name: Dragons of Atlantis
136698.description:
Dragons of Atlantis is a fantasy game by Kabam, Inc. It is a strategy game where a player has to build his own empire. The game is available free of charge (free-to-play) on Facebook, Google+, Yahoo Games, Kongregate, and the developer's website Kabam.com. The main objective is to increase one's empire's strength and unit count and attack others. There are camps called "Anthropus camps" which provide supplies of resources and Great Dragon armor. There is no definite end to the game.

Source: Wikipedia, "Dragons of Atlantis", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

136699.name: Game Boy Color Game Link Cable
videogamehwversion: Game Boy Color Game Link Cable
136699.description:
After the Game Boy Pocket came the Game Boy Light (a backlit Game Boy Pocket only released in Japan), and the Game Boy Color, all share the same link cable port design, and Game Boy Color games and original Game Boy games can both use a second generation cable. Therefore, the Game Boy Color is compatible with the MGB-008 and MGB-010. Despite this, the Game Boy Color did receive its own designated link cable, the Game Boy Color Game Link Cable (model CGB-003) however it was no different functionally than the MGB-008.

Source: Wikipedia, "Game Link Cable", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

136700.name: Game Boy Advance Game Link Cable
videogamehwversion: Game Boy Advance Game Link Cable
136700.description:
The third generation started with the release of the Game Boy Advance which was released alongside its own link cable called the Game Boy Advance Game Link Cable (model AGB-005) It features yet another new type of link cable port which is used on the Game Boy Advance, Game Boy Advance SP and Game Boy Player. This link cable can only be used for connecting Game Link compatible Game Boy Advance games. The cable also features a link cable 'hub' in the middle allowing the use of up to two additional link cables to connect up to four players at once, in this configuration the plugs are designed so as to be only inserted into the hub in one way due to the plug shapes.

Source: Wikipedia, "Game Link Cable", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

136701.name: Game Boy Advance Wireless Adapter
136701.description:
Like the Game Boy Advance Game Link Cable, this device allows for multiplayer gaming with the Game Boy Advance, and attaches via the External Extension Connector. The range of this adapter is short compared to the built-in wireless function of the Nintendo DS; Nintendo recommends players stay within 10 ft. (about 3m) of each other for best results. Note that due to the Game Boy Micro's different style link cable port, the Game Boy Advance Wireless Adapter will not attach to it. However, a Game Boy Micro Wireless Adapter is available for the Micro which is compatible for linking with the Game Boy Advance Wireless Adapter. Neither wireless adapter can connect with the Nintendo DS since the DS does not support multiplayer mode in Game Boy Advance games.

Source: Wikipedia, "Game Boy Advance Wireless Adapter", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

136702.name: Goodgame Empire
136702.description:
User Summary

Goodgame Empire is an browser based multiplayer strategy game in which players develop their medieval empire alongside their neighbours. Creating allies or enemies will affect the progress of one's empire. The world map is large and dynamic, in that locations may be taken over by players.

136703.name: Fire Fighters
136703.description:
Each player chooses a fire station and helmet of the same color.
Alarm Cards are turned face down and placed on the table. Fireman #1 picks an alarm card and says "fire is at ------- (name shown on the card)

Fireman #2 spins the spinner and moves his helmet the number of spaces shown on the spinner.

The fireman who first reaches the fire removes the card putting out the fire.

All firemen then return to their station and play continues with each player reporting a fire. The game ends when any player puts out 3 fires.

136704.name: 21 Plots Index
136704.description:
From the introduction:

The following is an index for our 21 Plots series of books. All four of the current books are covered by this index. Locations, themes, organizations, corporations, and objects found within certain plots are listed in alphabetical order below. These are listed by giving the name of the topic followed by the abbreviation for the book containing the plot.

136705.name: An English Night to Remember
136705.description:
From the Introduction:

England 1914

The end of the Victorian Era gave way to Queen Victoria's son King Edward VII. Known as the Edwardian Era, it was known as the period of excess, surrounded by garden parties, endless balls year-round and the traditionalism of the rigid class system that was the British Empire.

But that's about to change.

With the rise of the middle class, and a war looming on the brink, the rigidity of the Aristocracy is being forced to make room for the New Men and “New Money” of the age. Add a dash of beautiful women fighting for the right to be more than just housewives, and you have a recipe for a high-end or even low-end Fiasco..

136706.name: Beneath an Opal Moon
136706.description:
From the Back Cover

Beneath an Opal Moon is an introductory scenario for Samurai of Legend characters. It takes place in an isolated village in a southern Honshu province and is designed for between three and five characters, which can be samurai, sōhei, a mixture of the two and include a priest. The scenario should provide a couple of strong sessions of play and produce ideas for future adventures.

136707.name: The Objectivist
136707.description:
From the introduction:

The Objectivist.

Is he a dedicated antihero with a brutal but firm concept of justice? Or is he a sociopathic serial killer who chooses criminals as his victims?

Ultimately we would like to leave that fine distinction up to you, dear reader. In this brief character dossier, we will provide a short overview of the history and complete game statistics for a vicious vigilante that goes by the name The Objectivist. With the information included in this document you will be able to insert the Objectivist directly into your M&M game, whether as an NPC or as a pregenerated player character. The point costs for creating the Objectivist have also been included to allow for easy customization should the GM or Player wish to alter his game stats or adjust his power level.

136708.name: Five Go A-Role-Playing
136708.description:
From the designer's website:
Return to a world of England between the wars, when boys and girls full of spunk could head off into the hills for adventure with nothing more than a hamper of sandwiches and lashings of ginger beer.

This simple rpg includes everything you need to roleplay stories of the Five, or other Blyton heroes, or heroes of your own creation. Includes a random adventure generation table and several wizard uses for a whopper in your trousers.

Ginger beer lashings sold separately.

136709.name: Locket Away
136709.description:
From the introductory notes:
Welcome to Locket Away, a solo adventure using the Unbelievably Simple Role Playing system(available for free!) devised by Scott Malthouse.

This adventure is designed for a starting character who is a hard boiled investigator in the dangerous and unpredictable fantasy city of Jailton. This will serve as an introduction to the USR rules.

User comment:
This PDF solitaire adventure has clickable links for the numbered paragraph choices throughout.

136710.name: Bump Bump Pig
136710.description:
In Bump Bump Pig, piggies with many different characteristics live in a peaceful town, and if they "bump" against someone, they bring a change of fortune to the other individual, possibly good, possibly not so good.

Players take turns acting as the Master, and in each round the Master receives piggy cards from other players. Some piggies will allow both players to score or take some special action, while others might have bad effects. The Master can use piggy cards in front of himself to avoid harm or seek out the highest reward.

136711.name: Bejeweled Blitz
136711.description:
Game description from the publisher:

Ready, set, match! Featuring lights and sounds from PopCap's popular Facebook game and mobile app, Hasbro's Bejeweled Blitz dazzles with sparkling, translucent three-dimensional gem tiles. Kids will have fun finding matches of three while building gem towers. The first to get rid of all their gem tiles before time runs out wins!

boardgamehonor: 2013 Kinderspiel des Jahres Recommended
136712.description:
While practicing his powers, Linus, the little magician, has enchanted some of his toys! Can you help him pick up these toys from the floor of his room and put them away?

To set up Linus, der kleine Magier, you shuffle 18 magnetized toy tiles (three each of six different toys) with 12 non-magnetized toy tiles (two tiles of each type), then spread them out on the table. Shuffle the 18 search cards (showing three each of six different toys) as well, then give the youngest player the Linus wooden figure, which has a magnet on its underside.

On a turn, the player looks at the top search card, then places Linus on one of the toy tiles that matches this image. Did you find an enchanted toy that sticks to Linus? Super! Keep the toy tile and the search card, then give Linus to the next player. If, however, you found a regular toy tile, leave it on the table in the same location, then give Linus to the next player, who must now search for the same item (but with the hope of finding an enchanted one this time).

Once all the enchanted toys have been cleared from the table, whoever has found the most toys wins!
136712.name: Linus, der kleine Magier

136713.name: Defense Grid: Containment
136713.description:
User Summary

Defense Grid: Containment is a kickstarter funded expansion, designed to bridge the story between the the original game and the forthcoming sequel. In addition to the eight new maps, each with a number of different challenge modes to defeat, Containment includes greatly expanded voice acting, with two new characters added to support the AI character of the original game.

136714.name: WPA
136714.description:
WPA: Work Progress Action invites players to participate in relief projects like those that were operating in America during the Great Depression.
Monopoly style game: roll and move around the game board, draw a card, try to collect the most money and win the game.

136715.name: Frischer's Fitz
136715.description:
This is described as a fun tongue-twister game.

The nicely illustrated cards are shuffled and placed face down on the table.

The first player picks the top card from the pile, notes the text, place the card face down in front of him and speaks the tongue-twisting sentence aloud. If he is deemed to be correct, without pause or error, he gets to keep the card. But if he has made ​​a mistake or speaks too slowly, he has to pass the card to his left neighbour, who makes the same attempt.

If none of the players could recite the phrase correctly, the card is placed under the deck.

Winner is the player with the most cards after the deck has been exhausted.

136717.name: Final Approach (TRS-80)
136717.description:
In-Game Documentation

This is a simulation of a GCA (Ground Controlled Approach.) The glide path is an imaginary line from the end of the runway to the point where the descent should start (usually about 6 miles out at 1500 feet altitude). The program will put you in that position and then you will control the airspeed and rate of descent to keep the aircraft on the glide path.

You are flying a big multi-engine airplane - good luck and happy landings!

136718.name: BBC Archimedes
136718.description:
User Summary

The first range of Archimedes computers, still branded as BBC at this point instead of Acorn.

136719.name: Acorn Archimedes
136719.description:
User Summary

The second line of Archimedes computers, now branded as Acorn instead of BBC.

136720.name: Acorn R
136720.description:
User Summary

The much higher priced "RISC iX" workstations.

136721.name: Acorn A5000
136721.description:
In 1991, the A5000 was launched. It featured the new 25 MHz ARM3 processor, 2 or 4MB of RAM, either a 40 MB or an 80 MB hard drive and a more conventional 2U rack pizza box-style two-part case (HxWxD: 100 x 430 x 340 mm). Its enhanced video capabilities allowed the A5000 to comfortably display VGA resolutions of up to 800×600 pixels. It was the first Archimedes to feature a High Density capable floppy disc drive as standard. This natively supported various formats including DOS and Atari discs. A later version of the A5000 featured a 33 MHz ARM3, 4 or 8 MB of RAM, an 80 or 120 MB hard drive.

The A5000 initially ran the new 3.0 version of RISC OS, although several bugs were identified; most were shipped with RISC OS 3.10 or 3.11. As before, earlier machines were capable of being upgraded to the new RISC OS 3, though some needed help, as well as the ARM3 CPU. Earlier models could also benefit from the video performance of the A5000 via a third party upgrade.

Source: Wikipedia, "Acorn Archimedes", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

136722.name: BBC A3000
136722.description:
The A3000 used an 8 MHz ARM2 and was supplied with 1 MB of RAM. Unlike the previous models, the A3000 came in a single-part case similar to the BBC Micro, Amiga 500 and Atari ST computers, with the keyboard integrated in the base unit. This kind of housing consumes a lot of desktop space, a problem that Acorn tried to overcome by offering a monitor stand that attached to the base unit. The new model sported only a single internal expansion slot, which was physically different from that of the earlier models, although electronically similar. An external connector could interface to existing expansion cards, although they really needed to be housed in an external case joined to the main unit.

Source: Wikipedia, "Acorn Archimedes", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

136723.name: Acorn A30x0
136723.description:
In 1992, a new range was produced, the first ARM macrocell: the ARM250 microprocessor, a single-chip design including an ARM3 chip without cache, and the IOC1 (Input Output Controller), VIDC1a (VIDeo and sound Controller) and MEMC1 (MEMory Controller) chips all integrated into one chip. The increase in clock frequency, from 8 MHz to 12 MHz, gave a performance of 7 MIPS. They run RISC OS 3.10. The A30x0 series had a one-piece design, similar to the A3000 but far smaller, while the A4000 looked like a slightly slimmer A5000. The A3010 model was intended to be a home computing machine, featuring a TV modulator and joystick ports, while the A3020 targeted the home office and educational markets, featuring a built-in 2.5" hard drive and a dedicated network interface socket.

Source: Wikipedia, "Acorn Archimedes", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

136724.name: Acorn A4000
136724.description:
Technically, the A4000 was almost identical to the A3020, only differing in hard disk size (3.5" in the A4000), though it sported a different appearance.

Source: Wikipedia, "Acorn Archimedes", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

136725.name: Acorn A4
136725.description:
Also in 1992, Acorn introduced a laptop computer called A4 that featured an ARM3 processor like the A5000, even though it had a slightly lower clock speed, and a LCD screen capable of displaying a maximum resolution of 640 × 480 pixels in 15 levels of grey. However, it did feature a monitor port which offered the same display capabilities as an A5000. A notable omission from the machine was a built-in pointing device, requiring users to navigate with the cursor keys or attach a conventional Acorn three-button mouse.

Source: Wikipedia, "Acorn Archimedes", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

136726.name: Echo Dungeon
136726.description:
Welcome skilled treasure hunter to the ever-changing Echo Dungeon. It will take strategy, skill, and a fair amount of luck to make it to the treasure. Choose your equipment well for it may be the difference between untold wealth and leaving empty handed. However, the real question isn't if you can make it to the treasure but if you can make it back out.

Echo Dungeon is a light PnP dungeon crawler. Where the objective is to make it to the Treasure Room and back to the Entrance Stairs first. The only drawback is that most of rooms have traps that are trying to prevent you from doing so. This is achieved by placing randomly picked tiles as you make your way through the dungeon.

This game can be played with 1-4 players.

136727.name: Mutants & Masterminds: Supernatural Handbook
136727.description:
Publisher Blurb:

There are Things That Go Bump in the Night... The Supernatural Handbook is a sourcebook of heroic horror for the Mutants & Masterminds Superhero Roleplaying Game. It lays out the elements for a successful M&M game in which the strange and paranormal are true and a few lone heroes struggle against the Things That Go Bump in the Night. Join the fight against ancient evils and occult menaces with the Supernatural Handbook! You're Not Afraid... Are you?

136728.name: Anima Tactics: Wolfgang Metzger
136728.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Mercenary, executioner, murderer ... there isn't an infamous title that Wolfgang hasn't taken to heart. His great physical prowess isn't the only reason that he has become part Gaul's personal forces. The blood of the Naga runs through his veins, making him able to poison his enemies with just a touch of his skin.

Dark Azur Alliance Warrior — Lv. 40

Poison Ramalen: Any unit that comes into contact with Wolfgang for the first time suffers Blind Lv2. Effect 14.
Son of the Naga: Enemy units within Wolfgang's Control Zone suffer double damage due to the Poison state.
Poisoned Weapons: If any attack made by Wolfgang causes damage, the target suffers Poison Lv 2. Effect 14.
ooo — Cupra (Ki, Attack)
+4 Attack. If this attack causes damage, the effect of the Poison state is 16 instead of 14.

136730.name: Rosa Negra (Número 5 - Abr/Mar 1996)
rpg: In Nomine Satanis / Magna Veritas (2nd Edition)
rpgpublisher: Asociación Juvenil de interpretación Lúdica de León
136730.description:
Rosa Negra Fanzine #5
Summary in Spanish:

ARTÍCULOS:
Fauna rolera
Nuestro Comics, La Búsqueda del Pájaro del Tiempo
Grimorios Antiguos, por Mario Grande e Inma Florez
Rayos-X; Entrevista con José Antonio Telleache y Francisco José Campos, , por Mario Grande e Inma Florez.
Fabrica de Sueños, por Alejandro Fresno y Mario Grande
A todo volumen, por Manuel Fidalgo
A toda pantalla, por Rodrigo Shock y Ricardo Chao
AYUDAS Y COMENTARIOS
Fanhunter, nueva hoja de narizón
Desde la Tumba; Star Treck, por Claudio Pombo Rodríguez
Hombre Lobo; La Maldición de la Luna, por Mario Grande
RuneQuest; Boldhome, un artículo de la revista Tattou traducida por Alex Fernández
MODULOS
Piratas; Los tres días en Tortuga, por Alfredo García
Magna Veritas; de Hombres y bestias, por Francisco José Sáez Núñez
Vampiro; Vudú en los Pantanos, por Oscar Murciego
Cyberpunk; Mentes de metal, por Alejandro Fresno

136731.name: Catch the Ark
136731.description:
A flood is coming and Catch the Ark’s three adorable creatures Titan, Boon, and Zuzu haven’t got an invite to board Noah’s Ark. Armed with just a raft, the trio must brave the jungle rapids where outrageous hazards, hungry enemies, and even grumpy old Noah himself is out to ensure they don’t make it out alive. Can you catch the ark?

Source: The Publisher Website.

136732.name: The Fires of Heaven: A Space Opera Setting for the HERO System, Sixth Edition
136732.description:
Publisher Blurb:

A decade ago, the United Worlds and Vorn were at war. Just as we never knew why they attacked, we never knew why they withdrew from U.W. space, but given the losses suffered, we were glad they did. The Vorn remain a weight on the minds of U.W. military planners, but life goes on for everyone else. From the domes covering the frozen wastes of Tawhirimatea to the lush jungles of Yewel, humans the other races of the U.W. live, work and squabble on dozens of inhabited worlds, deal with the everchanging Jodoni demenses, wonder about the aloof, cryptically prescient Ethereans, and worry about what was important enough to the Vorn to have them retreat when their victory was nearly certain. Fires of Heaven by veteran game designer Patrick Sweeney is a massive 258 page gameworld for the HERO System 6th Edition, with details on every aspect of the United Worlds, alien races, starship design and combat, psionics, and more.

136733.name: Rosa Negra (Número 6 - Ene/Feb 1997)
rpgpublisher: Asociación Juvenil de interpretación Lúdica de León
136733.description:
Rosa Negra Fanzine #6
Summary in Spanish:

ARTÍCULOS:
Fauna rolera
Oráculo; Nueva sección dedicada a novedades, por Alejandor Fresno
Grimorios a la carta; Orson Scott Card, por Mario Grande
Nuestros Cómics; Blood, por Alejandro Fresno
Fabrica de Sueños, por Alejandro Fresno, Mario Grande e Inma Florez.
En Pantalla, Rodrigo Shock y Alejandro Fresno
A todo volumen, por Mario Grande
Los Ojos del Dragón; Nueva sección dedicada a Ilustraciones,
Cajón Desastre, por Inma Florez y Mario Grande
Deirdre; Relato basado en una leyenda irlandesa.
AYUDAS Y COMENTARIOS
Castillo de Falkestein, por Francisco José Sáez Núñez
KAE; Ayuda para AD&D / RQ, por Mario Grande
Des de la Tumba; Warhammer FRP, por Mario Grande
MODULOS
Vampiro; Manos Ensagrentadas, por Inma Florez y Mario Grande
Fanhunter; Alejo: Love and War, por Águila Garrapiñada
La Llamada de Cthulhu; El Misterio de los Oculto, por Sergio Martínez Domenech
Atlantis; El Terror Sumergido, por Alejandro Fresno

136734.name: Swing King
136734.description:
Fling the King, save the kingdom!

The King’s furry kingdom is in jeopardy. Time to swing into action!

Fling the King across levels, through obstacles and traps to grab stars and reach his flying unicorn. Use simple touch controls to aim the King’s trajectory, move obstacles out of his way, and use power-ups such as the sticky grappling point and the boxing glove. Your kingdom is in trouble. What are you waiting for?

Source: The Developer Website.

136735.name: Temple Run 2
136735.description:
User Summary

The sequel to one of the most popular endless runners in history.

Temple Run 2 relies on the same basic mechanisms as its predecessor: swipe up to jump, swipe down to slide, tilt left and right to collect coins, and at all costs avoid the evil monkey (now there is just one big one, instead of a horde of little ones). But Imangi has updated the game with new, sharper graphics; more varied and more organic environments; and a whole new array of power ups.

136736.name: Pioneer LaserActive
videogamehwversion: Sega PAC for Genesis/Sega CD games
136736.description:
User Summary

An experiment ahead of its time - before the PS2's built-in DVD player took the entertainment world by storm, Pioneer released the LaserActive - a laserdisc player with modules that would allow Sega Genesis, Sega CD, and TG-16 games to be played. High prices and low sales quickly doomed this massive system (physically, it's probably twice the size of the original Xbox).

136737.description:
With the Merseburg Promokarte is Merseburg (hometown of "Spiele-Schmiede)part of the game. It is only another card in the game.
With this Promocard I change the basecard No. 15 from the basegame starting map and I have the other station MERSEBURG. There is no change in the game, only another station.
136737.name: Express 01: Merseburg Promokarte

136738.name: Cozmica
136738.description:
Cozmica is a 2-player abstract strategy game. The theme of Cozmica is about relocating Earth life in DNA form, to a new world in the cosmos for survival. Both players sit on opposite sides of a 9 x 9 line grid board similar to a Go board.
Each player receives either 18 black or 18 white “Go stone like” playing pieces (Bio-ships). Playing pieces are marked with either an Animal, Plant, or Microbe symbol. The pieces interact with each other similar to the mechanics of Rock, Paper, Scissors, i.e.
Animals eat Plants, Plants absorb Microbes, and Microbes infect Animals.
All pieces move the same way…1 or 2 places, Horizontally, Vertically or Diagonally.
The objectives of the game are:
1. Surround and capture opponents Bio-ships.
2. Intercept and eliminate opponents Bio-ships.
3. Cross your own Bio-ships to the other side and off the board.
4. You acquire colonies by capturing opponents Bio-ships or crossing your own to the other side and off the board.
5. To win the game, you must establish at least one colony. They may be mixed [your’s and/or your opponents as long as they form a colony.
A colony is: 1 each of all 3 DNA types, 1 Animal, 1 Plant, 1 Microbe.
Playing time is about 30 to 60 minutes.

136741.name: Tesla's Revenge
136741.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – VAPORWARE




This game is stuck in the development limbo known as Vaporware. Few to no details have been released about about its gameplay, plot, or release date since its announcement many years ago. It may or may not be in active development, but neither has it been cancelled officially.




Tesla's Revenge is an electricity-themed puzzle game designed by Orin Bishop and being developed for iOS by Codito Development under their Sage Board Games brand.

From its original roots as a more traditional abstract head-to-head strategy game, in a board form, the game has evolved into a challenging and fun solo puzzle game in app form.

The player and the AI both have a power supply at their end of the board and a number of electrical orbs that are connected back to that power supply. The catch is that if an orb is not connected back to your power supply, via a chain of your own orbs, then it loses power and cannot be moved again until power is restored to it.

Orbs move by being swapped with one of your opponent's orbs or into an empty spot on the grid. You defeat your opponent by completely disconnecting their orbs from their power supply, or forcing them to disconnect their last connected orb.

The resulting "push-pull" dynamic, where you will sometimes be disconnecting your own pieces and sometimes be reconnecting your pieces, is visualized perfectly on the screen with animations and lightning effects. You can literally see the balance of power shifting back and forth.

Your challenge in this compelling puzzler is to find a solution to each level, collecting light bulbs in order to earn new power-ups along the way (these will also be available via In App Purchase). Power-ups will unlock additional levels and add further layers of complexity to the game.

Source: The Publisher Website.

136742.description:
Claws of Chaos is the first expansion for the Fleets at War! tactical starship combat game. It is played on the floor or a large table with cardboard counters representing capital ships, fighters, and other space craft. Simplified game mechanics let players engage in small skirmishes all the way up to large-scale battles involving dozens of ships.

Features:

--New Factions: the K'thonians and the Talions
--New ships: battlecruisers, drone carriers (and drones), torpedo boats and torpedo bombers
--New weapons: particle guns, plasma bolt cannons, mines, torpedoes and anti-matter missiles.
--Full-color ship counters + additional counters for fighters & missiles
--Stat Cards (one for each ship class)
--Seven new scenarios

Note: You will need to have the Fleets at War! rulebook to use this expansion.
136742.name: Imperium Chronicles: Fleets at War – Claws of Chaos

136743.name: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban (GBA)
videogameversion: North American Game Boy Advance edition
videogamehonor: 2005 D.I.C.E. Family Game of the Year Nominee
2006 British Academy Game Awards Best Handheld/Mobile Game of the Year Nominee
2006 British Academy Game Awards Best Soundtrack of the Year Nominee
136743.description:
User Summary

Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban for the GBA is a traditional turn based RPG. The game does support linking with the GameCube version of the game. The game also closely follows the story of the movie.

Box Back of US North American GBA edition

THE DEMENTORS ARE COMING... AND THIS TIME HARRY NEEDS HIS FRIENDS.

-Play as Harry, Ron, and Hermione
-Facce the Dementors
-All New Mini-Games

136744.name: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban (PC)
videogamehonor: 2005 D.I.C.E. Family Game of the Year Nominee
2006 British Academy Game Awards Best Handheld/Mobile Game of the Year Nominee
2006 British Academy Game Awards Best Soundtrack of the Year Nominee
136744.description:
User Summary

Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban for Windows is a 3D action adventure like the console games of the same name but it is has completely different levels and challenges.

Box Back of US Windows edition

THE DEMENTORS ARE COMING... AND THIS TIME HARREY NEEDS HIS FRIENDS.

-Fly Buckbeak
-All New Spells
-Best-Ever Graphics

136745.name: Apple II
136745.description:
The Apple II (styled as Apple ][) is an 8-bit home computer, one of the first highly successful mass-produced microcomputer products, designed primarily by Steve Wozniak, manufactured by Apple Computer (now Apple Inc.) and introduced in 1977. It is the first model in a series of computers which were produced until Apple IIe production ceased in November 1993.

The first Apple II computers went on sale on June 10, 1977 with a MOS Technology 6502 microprocessor running at 1 MHz, 4 kB of RAM, an audio cassette interface for loading programs and storing data, and the Integer BASIC programming language built into the ROMs. The video controller displayed 24 lines by 40 columns of monochrome, upper-case-only (the original character set matches ASCII characters 20h to 5Fh) text on the screen, with NTSC composite video output suitable for display on a TV monitor, or on a regular TV set by way of a separate RF modulator. The original retail price of the computer was 1298 USD (with 4 kB of RAM) and 2638 USD (with the maximum 48 kB of RAM). To reflect the computer's color graphics capability, the Apple logo on the casing was represented using rainbow stripes, which remained a part of Apple's corporate logo until early 1998. The earliest Apple II's were assembled in Silicon Valley, and later in Texas; printed circuit boards were manufactured in Ireland and Singapore.

Source: Wikipedia, "Apple II", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

136746.name: Conspiracy of Shadows: Apprentice
136746.description:
From the Website:

Conspiracy of Shadows: Apprentice is a short form, self-contained role-playing game centered around one man's quest to take the place of his master.
