Including detailed stats on every key system, this supplement also includes basic rules to help guide players in developing BattleTech scenarios focused on defending—or attacking—these critical sites.

136824.name: SG-1000
136824.description:
The SG-1000 (エスジー・セン Esujī Sen), which stands for Sega Game 1000, was a cartridge-based video game console manufactured by Sega. This system marked Sega's first entry into the home video game hardware business, and while the system was not popular, it provided the basis for the more successful Sega Master System.

Source: Wikipedia, "Sega SG-1000", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

136825.name: SDS Pengespil
136825.description:
SDS Sparekassen published this game, heavily inspired by Matador / Monopoly. It was published at the latest in 1983, but the specific year could not be found.

You try to earn money by building up a business empire with help from SDS Sparekassen.


SDS Sparekassen udgav dette spil, tungt inspireret af Matador/Monopoly. Det blev udgivet senest 1983, men det specifikke årstal kunnet ikke findes.

Du prøver på at tjene så mange penge som muligt, ved at oprette en masse forretninger med hjælp fra SDS Sparekassen.

136826.name: SG-3000
136826.description:
The SC-3000 was the computer equivalent of the SG-1000.
The SC-3000 sold for ¥29,800 (USD$386.81) in 1983 and was marketed as a computer for beginners. Since games were compatible with both the SC-3000 and SG-1000, and since the SC-3000 was also able to run computer applications, it outsold the SG-1000.

Users were able to create their own programs and games on the machine in BASIC, as well as machine code. A speech synthesis unit, light pen, and several other third party accessories were also available.

Source: Wikipedia, "Sega SG-1000", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

136827.name: SF-7000
136827.description:
The SC-3000 had an add-on called the SF-7000. The SF-7000 added 64KB of RAM and 8KB ROM, a 3-inch floppy disk drive, a Centronics parallel port, and an RS232 serial port.

Source: Wikipedia, "Sega SG-1000", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

136828.name: Odyssey²
136828.description:
"The Magnavox Odyssey², known in Europe as the Philips Videopac G7000, in Brazil as the Philips Odyssey, in the United States as the Magnavox Odyssey² and the Philips Odyssey², and also by many other names, is a video game console released in 1978."

Source: Wikipedia, "Magnavox_Odyssey²", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

136829.name: M & M's Mini Madness
videogameversion: North American Game Boy Color edition
136829.description:
User Summary

Something goes wrong in the M&M candy factory, and it is up to Red, Yellow, Green, and Blue to find out what happened and fix it.

136830.name: Dragon's Dogma: Dark Arisen
videogamehonor: 2014 D.I.C.E. Role-Playing Game of the Year Nominee
136830.description:
User Summary

The Dark Arisen expansion adds 25 new enemy types, new skills & abilities, 100+ new pieces of equipment, 14 additional character & pawn augments, new tiers of equipment enhancement, increased character customization options, and the option to use the Japanese voice-overs. Dark Arisen will allow players to transfer their save file from Dragon's Dogma and includes the main game. An HD texture pack to improve the games textures is included in the PS3 installation and on a separate disc for the Xbox 360.

The expansion will take place on an isle called Bitterblack Isle.

136831.name: Mary-Kate and Ashley: Crush Course
videogameversion: North American Game Boy Color edition
136831.description:
Back of the box

RUSH TO FIND YOUR CRUSH! Race through the halls of school, cruise the mall, or hang out at the park to collect the hearts of the coolest boys in town.

136832.name: Mary-Kate and Ashley: Get a Clue!
videogameversion: North American Game Boy Color edition
136832.description:
Back of the box

Will solve any crime by dinnertime! Team up again with Mary-Kate, Ashley and their trusty dog Clue to solve all new exciting cases filled with suspense, mystery and thrills!

From a spooky summer camp to a mystifying museum, these sleuths have the adventures of a lifetime!

136833.name: Mary-Kate and Ashley: Pocket Planner
videogameversion: North American Game Boy Color edition
136833.description:
Back of the box

Keep your busy life under control in the coolest way possible. Organize while having fun.

This planner does have some minigames including a slot machine, a memory matching game, a sliding puzzle, and dexterity game where you must catch falling items.

136834.name: Star Trek
136834.description:
UNLICENSED GAME




This game represents an unlicensed use of elements of the Star Trek franchise.




User Summary

Star Trek (more commonly known as Super Star Trek) is a text-based game developed in 1971 by Mike Mayfield (although some later versions incorporated graphics). The game was originally written on an SDS Sigma 7, but was ported to an HP2000C and was part of an HP program library. It was ported to a variety of systems, with various modifications. However, the most well-known version of the game is Super Star Trek, written in BASIC and published in David Ahl's BASIC Computer Games. After the release of BASIC Computer Games, the game was widely copied to home computers in the late '70s. The game has been moderately influential, inspiring amongst others Star Raiders and Star Fleet I: The War Begins.

The game consists of the player, in control of the starship Enterprise, hunting down Klingon ships randomly scattered throughout the galaxy. All the Klingon ships must be eliminated by a certain stardate. The Enterprise has Phasors and Photon Torpedos as weapons, as well as a number of other thematically appropriate capabilities to help achieve this end. The galaxy is composed of an 8x8 grid of quadrants and in addition to Klingon ships contains stars and also friendly starbases, where the Enterprise can be repaired and refueled. Each quadrant is composed of an 8x8 (in most but not all games) set of sectors, in which the Enterprise, Klingon ships, stars, and starbases are represented spatially in relation to each other.

136835.name: Mary-Kate and Ashley: Winners Circle
videogameversion: North American Game Boy Color edition
136835.description:
User Summary

A game with Mary-Kate and Ashley Olson riding horses, competing in tournaments and completing challenges. The tournaments involve racing on an equestrian course with jumps and obstacles. Challenges include different timed events, collection challenges, and more.

136836.name: Schwarze Gürtel des Munchkintums
136836.description:
[Translation of German Text]
The first prize in each Munchkin Fu Release tournament was a stylish black obi (karate belt) with the following text: "Black Belt of Munchkinism +3 bonus. Really."

1. The Black Belt of Munchkinism and its bonus has been approved by none other than Steve Jackson. It is official and may be used in any game.

2. Each player may only wear one black belt of Munchkinism. Whether it is worn around the waist or as a sash (for the somewhat stouter player), is irrelevant. The Black Belt of Munchkinism is always valid. Although the belt is very long, it may not be used by two or more players at one time.

3. The Black Belt is considered small object, has no value, and does not occupy a slot (hands, arms, etc). If it needs to be taken off, it is moved to (or next to) the discard pile.

4. If a player loses their Black Belt of Munchkinism (due to trade, thievery, or death), he can not put in on again, unless he changes his gender.

It should be understood that a stolen Black Belt Munchkinism is given back to the owner after the end of the game.

[ORIGINAL TEXT]
Der erste Preis bei jedem Munchkin Fu Release Turnier war ein stylischer schwarzer Obi (Karategürtel) mit folgender Aufschrift: "Schwarzer Gürtel des Munchkintums. +3 Bonus. Wirklich."

1. Der Schwarze Gürtel des Munchkintum und sein Bonus sind von niemand geringerem als Steve Jackson abgesegnet worden. Damit ist er offiziell und darf in jedem Spiel eingesetzt werden.

2. Jeder Spieler darf nur einen Schwarzen Gürtel des Munchkintums tragen. Ob er um die Hüfte oder als Schärpe (für die etwas stärkeren Spieler) getragen wird, ist gleichgültig. Der Schwarze Gürtel des Munchkintums kann jederzeit angelegt werden. Auch wenn der Gürtel besonders lang ist, darf er nicht von zwei oder mehr Spielern gleichzeitig eingesetzt werden.

3. Der Schwarze Gürtel des Munchkintums gilt als kleiner Gegenstand, er hat keinen Wert und belegt keinen Slot (Hände, Rüstung o.ä.). Wenn er abgelegt werden muss, wandert er auf den Ablagestapel (bzw. daneben).

4. Sollte ein Spieler den Schwarzen Gürtel des Munchkintums verlieren (Handel, Dieb, Tod oder beim-um-den-Tisch-tanzen-abgefallen) kann er ihn nicht wieder anlegen, es sei denn, er wechselt das Geschlecht.

Es sollte selbstverständlich sein, dass ein geklauter Schwarzer Gürtel des Munchkintums nach dem Ende des Spiels vom Besitzer an den Eigentümer zurück gegeben wird.

136837.name: The Mask of Zorro
videogameversion: North American Game Boy Color edition
136837.description:
User Summary

A side-scrolling action with the player taking control of the masked hero, Zorro. The game is based on the movie of the same name.

136838.name: Matchbox Caterpillar Construction Zone
videogameversion: North American Game Boy Color edition
136838.description:
User Summary

Players control the use of different trucks and machines to complete objectives in each stage. Stages take place in different environments such as a construction site, forest, etc. and the objectives match the needs of each stage.

136839.name: Matchbox Caterpillar Construction Zone 2: Mining for Gold
videogameversion: North American Game Boy Color edition
136839.description:
User Summary

A sequel to the first Caterpillar Construction Zone, this game takes the environment to the underground, on the search for precious metals.

136840.name: Men in Black: The Series
videogameversion: North American Game Boy Color edition
136840.description:
User Summary

A side-scrolling action game based on the cartoon television series of the same name. Run through the levels shooting aliens as different members of the Men In Black team.

136842.name: Atari 2600 Jr.
136842.description:
In 1985, a new version of the 2600 was released (although it had been planned for release two years earlier). The new redesigned version of the 2600, unofficially referred to as the 2600 Jr., featured a smaller cost-reduced form factor with a modernized Atari 7800-like appearance. The redesigned 2600 was advertised as a budget gaming system (under $50) that had the ability to run a large collection of classic games. With its introduction came a resurgence in software development both from Atari Corp. and from a few third parties (including Activision, Absolute Entertainment, Froggo, Epyx, and Exus). The Atari 2600 continued to sell in the USA and Europe until 1991, and in Asia until the early 1990s. Its final Atari-licensed release was KLAX in 1990. Over its lifetime, an estimated 30 million units were shipped, and its video game library reportedly numbers more than 900 titles with commercial games being released until 1991. In Brazil, the console became extremely popular in the mid-1980s. The Atari 2600 was officially retired by Atari Corp. on January 1, 1992, making it the longest-lived home video game console (14 years, 2 months) in video game history.

Source: Wikipedia, "Atari 2600", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

136843.name: Cargo Bay
136843.description:
User Summary

Cargo Bay is a box pushing puzzle set in a science fiction realm. 5 alien races have finally settled on a peace treaty, ending a long lasting war. This peace is bad for business, however, and a company of rogues have conjoined forces and have planted explosives within the cargo bays of politically sensitive ports. To prevent the fracturing of the newly made peace treaty, the player must remove all explosives from an area before they explode.
In Cargo Bay, the box pusher may only push one object at a time. Boxes cannot be pulled and barriers are immovable. This puzzler has timed levels but unlimited moves.

136844.name: 5200 Controller
136844.description:
The controller prototypes used in the electrical development lab used a yoke and gimbal mechanism that came from an RC airplane controller kit. This simple design gave smooth linear control and was highly reliable. The production controllers were quite different and a great disappointment to the electrical and software development teams. The design of the analog joystick, which used a weak rubber boot rather than springs to provide centering, proved to be ungainly and unreliable. They quickly became the Achilles' heel of the system because of their combination of an overly complex mechanical design with a very low-cost internal flex circuit system. Another major flaw of the controllers was that the design did not translate into a linear acceleration from the center through the arc of the stick travel. The controllers did, however, include a pause button, a unique feature at the time. Various third party replacement joysticks were also released, including those made by Wico.

Source: Wikipedia, "Atari 5200", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

136845.name: Catacomb
136845.description:
Catacomb is a 2-D game created by John Carmack. It was originally created for the Apple II, and later ported to the PC. It should not be confused with The Catacomb, which is the second game in the series (originally named Catacomb II, but later renamed). It supports EGA and CGA graphics.

In the game you play the magician Petton Everhail. At the start you are contacted by Terexin, High Wizard of the Kieralon who tells you how the Kieralon Empire has fallen. He convinces you to travel to the Kieralon Palace to collect his treasures and split them fifty-fifty.

Catacomb consists of ten levels. To progress to the next level you must step through a magic teleportation mirror. These mirrors are usually behind a locked door, requiring you to obtain a key to advance.

Source: Wikipedia, "Catacomb (video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

136846.name: Gamer's Edge Sampler
136846.description:
User Summary

The Gamer's Edge Sampler is a compilation of Dangerous Dave and Catacomb, released on one disk to subscribers.

136847.name: Conquering Corsairs
136847.description:
Conquering Corsairs is a card game in which you take the role of pirates, trying to gain gold and reputation to become the most feared and famous ship to sail the Silver Seas. You will take your ship to strange and dangerous locations, recruit new crew members to your cause, do battle with other pirates, and put plunder in your hold!

During the game, players take different actions during each of the four seasons of a turn. In Spring, you play pirates on to the deck of your ship. They will be needed to attack locations and recruit new shipmates in the following seasons. In Summer, you sail your ship between islands in the Silver Seas and can either try to conquer them or explore new locations, looking for plunder. In Fall, you recruit new pirates, taking them from either common supply piles or a personal supply that only you have access to. In Winter, you can stow treasure (cards) in your hold, that will gain you plunder at the end of the game. The Pirate King is also determined in Winter, based on the prestige that each player has obtained from their locations and any powerful pirates still in play.

136848.name: Lightning Returns: Final Fantasy XIII
136848.description:
Lightning Returns: Final Fantasy XIII (ライトニング リターンズ ファイナルファンタジーXIII Raitoningu Ritānzu: Fainaru Fantajī Sātīn?) is a console action role-playing video game developed and published by Square Enix for the PlayStation 3 and Xbox 360. It was released on November 2013 in Japan and February 2014 in Europe and North America. The game is a direct sequel to Final Fantasy XIII-2, concludes the storyline of Final Fantasy XIII, and forms part of the Fabula Nova Crystallis subseries. Lightning Returns employs a highly revamped version of the gameplay system from the previous two games, with an action-oriented battle system, the ability to customize the player character's outfits, and a time limit the player must extend by completing story missions and sidequests.

The story takes place five hundred years after the previous game's ending. Lightning, the main protagonist of the first game and a key character in the second, awakes from a self-imposed hibernation thirteen days before the world's end, and is chosen by the deity Bhunivelze to save the people of the dying world, including former friends and allies who have developed heavy emotional burdens. As she travels, she learns the full truth behind both the world's fate and Bhunivelze's true agenda.

Development of the game started in May 2012, shortly after the release of XIII-2's final piece of DLC, and was unveiled at a special 25th Anniversary Event for the Final Fantasy series in September that year. Most of the previous games' key creative minds and developers returned, and it was developed by Square Enix's First Production Department, with developer tri-Ace helping with the graphics. The development team wanted the game to bring a conclusive end to the story of both Lightning and the XIII universe, and to address criticisms leveled against the last two games. The game has received mixed reviews in both Japan and Western territories: while the main praise went to the game's battle system, opinions were more mixed for the graphics, time limit and other aspects of gameplay, while the story and characters were criticized for being weak and poorly developed.

Source: Wikipedia, "Lightning Returns: Final Fantasy XIII", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

136849.name: Vertigo
136849.description:
Back of the Box

Vertigo is a high-rolling, adrenalin-fuelled combination of puzzle solving, precision control and futuristic racing.

- 4 multiplayer modes: Time Trial, Xorb Ball, Death Match and Xorb bowling.
- 48 challenging tracks across 9 different environments.
- Wii Balance Board compatible with unique gaming mode.

136850.name: Nintendo 3DS XL
136850.description:
As with the Nintendo DSi XL, the 3DS XL features larger screens and longer battery life than the original 3DS. The screens are 90% larger (top: 4.88 in (124 mm), bottom: 4.18 in (106 mm), and the battery life is increased by 86%, while the weight of the console increases by 46% (336 grams). A 4 GB SD card comes packaged with the console instead of a 2 GB card included with the original 3DS. The 3DS XL does not work with the original Circle Pad Pro, but a compatible version of the accessory was announced as a future release.

Source: Wikipedia, "Nintendo 3DS", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

136851.name: Cholopoly
136851.description:
Cholopoly is a game based on our funny experiences in Peru. Each player will be a car driver. And will be driving through many dangerous streets of Peru in Lima.

You can buy business, escape from thieves, and bribing corrupt police. Face events like inflation, terrorism, mining company strikes, and supports corruption and become the richest one among all players.

There is no place for fair play. Destroy the other businesses, hire thieves and corrupt cops, to steal and bribe the other players.

Appropriate business and foreign characters, accumulate dirty money and become a millionaire, and lose it all from one turn to another.

Do not misunderstand; this is only taken with mockery, you just have a good time with your friends

Cholopoly wishes you a fun and unproductive game.

Cholopoly

Rie, Jode..., Juega

(Spanish version)

Cholopoly es un juego basado en nuestra criollada peruana. Cada jugador será un conductor, manejando por las peligrosas calles de lima en Peru. Comprando negocios, escapando de ladrones, y sobornando policias corruptos. Afronta eventos como inflación, terrorismo, huelgas mineras, y soporta casos de corrupción, e intenta volverte el más rico entre todos los jugadores.

No hay lugar para el juego limpio. Destruye los negocios de otros, contrata ladrones y policías corruptos, para que roben y sobornen a los otros jugadores.

Aprópiate de los negocios y personajes ajenos, acumula dinero corrupto. Conviértete en millonario, y piérdelo todo de un turno a otro.

No malinterpreten, esto es solo tomar con burla algunas situaciones. Y pasar un buen tiempo con tus amigos

Cholopoly les desea un entretenido e improductivo juego.

Cholopoly

Rie, Jode..., Juega

136852.name: Dance Dance Revolution: Ultramix 3
136852.description:
Back of the Box

Revolutionary - Online or Offline

The Revolution is Live! Xbox Live lets you download new songs and dance steps, upload content, compete head-to-head, view internet ranking, messaging, talk live and more!

- Over 70 songs and 100+ minutes of music from all styles and genres
- All new Freestyle Mode lets you dance the way you want to - no special dancesteps to follow
- Travel city to city and build the ultimate dance team in the new Quest Mode
- Listen to any song from the game and build your own playlists with the new Jukebox Mode
- Level for beginners allows you to learn the basics with an easy-to-follow on-screen dancer
- Get in shape with the Workout Mode and customize your own dance steps in the Edit Mode
- Includes playable demo of Karaoke Revolution Party
- Re-create the smash-hit experience in your living room with Konami's DDR Controller for Xbox (not included)*

User Summary

Note: The Konami DDR Controller for Xbox is included in the Xbox Bundle edition.

136853.name: V.Smile
136853.description:
A V.Smile generally has an on and an off button on the console itself and two joystick ports, and a compartment for keeping the cartridges in addition to the cartridge slot.

The buttons on the game system and controllers are large to accommodate small children's less developed manual dexterity. The default controller consists of an analog stick, four colored buttons, a large enter button, a button (dubbed the "Learning Zone" button) that immediately takes the player to a minigame section of the software, an Exit button (that either brings up an option to end the game or to keep playing, or to exit out of any menu that the player is in) and a Help button (which repeats the spoken instructions or hint provided by the game to the player).

Source: Wikipedia, "V.Smile", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

136854.name: V.Smile Pocket
136854.description:
The V.Smile Pocket is a handheld version of the V.Smile console. It features a built-in Passive matrix-based color LCD display and a monaural speaker, but is otherwise similar to the desktop console counterpart. However there is no connector for an additional joystick, and thus many games that support two player mode will disallow access selection of the said mode. Also, the device is not compatible with games that uses any of the other accessories due to the lack of an additional joystick port.

Source: Wikipedia, "V.Smile", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

136855.name: V.Smile Cyber Pocket
136855.description:
A third generation V.Smile Pocket was introduced in 2008. Called the V.Smile Cyber Pocket, the console was redesigned with a smaller flip-open screen (still Passive matrix-based) and an integrated graphics tablet, while retaining the microphone introduced in the second generation V.Smile Pocket. Also, a proprietary port was added to the console, which a flash drive like device with a matching proprietary connector on one end and a USB connector on another, could plug in to the Cyber Pocket. This device is used to transfer the data of games that support such function to a PC, which would in turn upload the data to a website. The data could then be used to chart the player's progress as well as be used to unlock bonus games on the said website.

Source: Wikipedia, "V.Smile", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

boardgamehonor: 2013 Guldbrikken Best Children's Game Nominee
2013 Guldbrikken Best Children's Game Winner
136856.name: Simsala Hopp
136856.description: Time for a magic tournament at Magicstone Castle! In Simsala Hopp, the young player magicians need to use their magic wands to transform frogs into hares while the animals fly through the air – but if they conjure things too freely, they risk sending animals arcing too high and landing outside the castle, and shenanigans like that will cost the magician points. Whoever can transform many frogs into rabbits without being too careless will collect the most tournament chips and win.

136857.description:
Colors far too awesome for a rainbow . . . try our Bubblegum Pink, Ninja Black, Glow in the Dark, Frosted, and Invisible Munchkins and Munchkin Babes, all in one package!

These pawns were previously only available in our Gen Con capsule machine, but now you can get the complete set without using up all your laundry money. And of course, they have a rule!

Any time you are entitled to go up a level -- or when you do something that WOULD earn you a level if you weren't already Level 9 -- you may, instead, place a Munchkin pawn in front of you. In any combat, you may discard it for a 1d6 bonus. You may only have one in front of you at a time. Unless, of course, you "lose" these rules and tell the other players that you're allowed to have more. Six is a good number. Eight is even better!

8 pawns in a poly bag. 4 Munchkin men & 4 Munchkin babes
136857.name: +8 Bag O' Munchkin Babes & Pawns

136858.name: Smile & Like It
136858.description:
Smile and Like It is a family-friendly card game for 3 - 8 players with a unique twist. On your turn, play a card and do what it says, simple as that. Generally the card will instruct you to claim chips (some face up, some face down, all of which have smiley faces of differing levels of happiness on one side) from the center pot, trade chips you've already collected with other players, and so on.

Here's the twist: you don't automatically get to draw a card at the end of your turn. Instead, you have to claim a special "draw" chip (differently colored than all the other chips in the pot) and have it remain in your score pile until your next turn, at which point you can replenish your hand of cards... but that's all you can do on that turn. Of course, there aren't enough draw chips in the pot for everyone.

So the tension builds: how long do you dare wait to take the draw chip? If you run out of cards, you lose chips from your pot to the players seated on either side of you... but if you happen to have a draw chip in your score pile at the end of the game, you take a massive penalty to your final score.

The game comes with three unique methods of scoring right in the box. One scoring system simply gives more points for happier smiley faces (very family friendly), one scores points for sets of different types of smileys (a bit more strategic, but still family friendly), and one uses patterns of smileys printed right on the cards, giving the players another option on how to play a card: playing it as a scoring card by spending the specific pattern of smileys in the score pile (introducing a hand management aspect to the game suitable for more hardcore gamers).

All in all, Smile and Like It is a game that is simple to learn and play, and yet difficult to master in any of its incarnations, making it a game you'll come back to again and again.

136859.description:
In the gripping murder mystery game Die drei ??? und der Feuerdiamant, the player detectives must work together to solve four criminal cases. With suspect cards, clues, hazard cards and alibi cards all at hand, not to mention hazard chips and power tokens, they're fighting against time, meaning that no risk is too large to take as otherwise the game is lost.

Each playing of Die drei ??? und der Feuerdiamant differs, so the game will still be fresh each time. What's more, the game will be available as an app that features great sounds, additional rules and surprise effects to make the game even more exciting.
136859.name: Die drei ??? und der Feuerdiamant

136861.name: Galileo Kids: Entdecke Wissen
136861.description:
A trivia game with 780 questions and answers.

By turning the colored roulette wheel the children choose the questions for each card. They select one of the answers to score points, in which each answer option is associated with a symbol, and a color.

There are many interesting topics from the fields of history, geography, biology, wildlife, art, music, sports and culture in general etc.

136862.name: Air Power
136862.description:
Back of Box

PREPARE TO WAGE WAR FOR TOTAL SUPREMACY

The first-ever 3-D airship combat game, Air Power puts you in complete control of a fleet of gargantuan airborne carriers that can launch and recover 8 different types of 3-D aircraft, each with varied strike capabilities.

Attack incoming enemy fighters. Obliterate ground targets. Gain the support of other countries through diplomacy, or take charge with military domination.

Either way, speed is essential. There are others who would rather see you go down in flames than rule.

BREATHTAKING FEATURES INCLUDE:


8 Awe-inspiring fictional aircraft to master -- each with varied strike capabilities.



Electrifying air combat scenarios keep you on the edge of your seat -- defend yourself against suicide rockets and rapid-fire rocket launchers during fierce dogfights.



A challenging combination of flight simulation and tactical strategy -- gain support of over 100 countries by diplomacy or force.



3 Computer controlled opponents test your strategic prowess.



A detailed map containing over 100 cities, towns, and villages helps you navigate through different regions, terrain, and climate.



Fully 3-D texture-mapped flight environment brings Air Power to life.



Awesome digitized sound effects, music, and radio chatter all add to the authentic flight command atmosphere.



Ten minute historical documentary with film footage.

136863.name: Mein Mann kann
136863.description:
The board game based on the German TVshow with relationship tests.

In the game it is important that the women know their husband well. They compete with other female teammates and put chips for different bets, eg Snacks eating contest or funny dance routines etc. If a bet is successful, the woman receives all applications and thus comes closer to the victory.

The women have to keep a cool head and play good bets. Essential is a good knowledge of the strengths of the man who in turn must show full commitment in the betting order to seal victory. "My husband can" is an ideal party game and suitable for couples or those who want to be there.

Couple with the most points is the winner.

136864.name: UFO 2012
136864.description:
Taken from the developers website

A mysterious organization suggested the absurd, at first glance,job to a former mercenary: gather together a team of fighters to kill the aliens in one of the remotest villages. Who would have thought that having agreed to fulfill the task of a mysterious intermediary organizations, Smith will play a key role in the fate of mankind.

Mysterious properties of UFO in 2012 game:

Unique combination of the global strategy and tactical battles:
battles in the cities, villages, forests and even on the bases of the aliens.
More than 35 technologies and 30 weapons.
Each type of an alien has unique features, interactions and require special tactics of warfare.
Quality 3D graphics.
Total freedom of action.
Intriguing plot.
Full entertainment is guaranteed.
Your task is:

Explore. Your scientists will disassemble all the parts of the found trophies to create a new outfit;
Decide. To provide a support from the air or to finance research and development - the choice is yours;
Get ready. Do you best to quip your soldiers for the task with weapons and armor;
Destroy. Full destructible introduces complete diversity in the gameplay - enter through the door, undermine the wall of a rocket or blew the tactical bombs of the entire building;
Be cunning. The agreed actions of the team and the use of the surrounding area will drive the alien into a trap;
Observe. Learn your enemy, know his true intentions and find his vulnerabilities;
Play. Play a key role in an epic confrontation and save the mankind.

136865.name: Back to Baghdad
136865.description:
Back of Box

WHAT MAKES A "SH*T HOT" PILOT?

Matching wits with the deadliest opponents in the world - and winning.

Now, you can hone your skills with the same accuracy as the military. "Back to Baghdad" is created directly from "Red Flag" and "Top Gun" flight simulators used in Air Force Pilot training. "Back to Baghdad" is the most realistic and accurate flight model on the market, complete with satellite photos from the U.S. Department of Defense, precise geographic data and 40 missions packed with Air to Ground attacks. "Back to Baghdad" will provide you with the most advanced combat simulation you have ever experienced...

Are you ready for the challenge?

136866.name: Wau Wau
136866.description:
The letter-cards are mixed and dealt 5 cards for each player, the top card of the remaining stack is revealed.
The objective is to get rid of cards.
In turn player can either use his cards to form a word or place the letters on the top cards that they continue the word.
If player can't form a word he draws a new card.
Words score points - the longer words more points - and player with the most points at the end of the game is the winner.

136867.name: Bingo Pocket Cards: Spaß mit englischer Grammatik
136867.description:
Simple quiz format card game. Distribute the cards amongst the players. Then take turns asking each other questions from the first card. The cards have numerous questions on them, with the answers on the back.

Rules are not clear about how many questions are asked per card. I would suggest just one. If the correct answer is given, the answering player takes the card.

The game proceeds for as long as you want to play or until a pre-set target of correct answers is reached. The player (or team) with the most cards, wins.

The cards all relate to fairly simple English grammar questions.

136868.name: Starship Troopers: Roughnecks
136868.description:
Taken from the publisher website

Starship Troopers: Roughnecks is an action game for mobile phones based on the classic book by Robert A. Heinlein that also spawned a movie and TV series.

The Roughnecks are a special elite squad of the Mobile Infantry, Earth's front line of defense against the vicious Bugs who intend to wipe out the human race. You take the role of John Rico, squad leader of Roughnecks, as you embark on planetary missions against the vicious aliens. Mission objectives very, ranging from seek-and-destroy missions to escort and rescue operations. Most of the time though, your goal is simply to blast the alien arachnids before they have a chance to get at you.

136869.name: F-22 Lightning II
136869.description:
Back of Box

F-22 LIGHTNING II - CONSIDER THE ENVELOPE BROKEN!

Introducing the new standard in flight simulation games - F-22 Lightning II. Rule the skies in the most realistic, action-packed jet fighter simulation ever created. Nothing else looks, sounds or feels more like the real F-22.

[Captions for screenshot illustrations]

Highly detailed simulation designed from authentic Lockheed Martin documentation. Features realistic cockpit instrumentation, accurate pitch and roll rates, and working control surfaces.

Fast and furious gameplay over the best looking 3-D terrains ever created. Day and night missions include desert, jungle, mountain and coastline landscapes.

Multiplayer capabilities via network, modem or serial connect. Requires no additional games!

Hear the thunder of your afterburners and the sounds of real combat action with Dolby Surround Sound.

Dynamic campaign structure changes missions based on the outcome of previous battles.

Features dozens of highly detailed, texture-mapped 3-D ground and air targets.

Multi-panning camera modes allow players to view the action from every angle.

Flight tested by Marine and Air Force pilots for realism. Fun and easy to play.

136870.name: Fighter Wing
136870.description:
Back of Box

Fighter Wing is a new breed of flight simulation game, offering the ultimate arcade flight combat experience with the world's top fighter aircraft, but without the steep learning curves. Armed with the high performance Gemsoft 3-D engine, real time terrain generation using real maps, a wide variety of challenging combat missions, and actual combat video footage, Fighter Wing packs an awesome arsenal that can outgun any flight combat simulator.


Support for all VGA modes up to and including 800 x 600.
CD-ROM version features actual video footage from the award winning TV series Fire Power.
Choose from training missions; multiple player missions for up to 16 players playing over a Local Area Network; and complex missions for 1-3 players competing against the computer.
Pilots can fly all of today's state-of-the-art aircraft from the world's most powerful nations, in the world's most dangerous hotspots.
Modem play option enables you to go head to head with opponents cross-town or cross-country.

136872.name: Giga Quiz: Mega-cities
136872.description:
With over 250 questions and answers about big cities, additional Joker and booster cards that affect the course of the game, provide games and guessing fun with the Giga-effect.

There are questions one side and 4 variants another side of the card. Draw a card, ask a question and read the variants. Who bet the correct answer scores a point.

Winner is the one with the most points after the deck is exhausted.

136873.name: Giga Quiz: Erfindungen
136873.description:
With over 250 questions and answers about inventions, additional Joker and booster cards that affect the course of the game, provide games and guessing fun with the Giga-effect.

There are questions one side and 4 variants another side of the card. Draw a card, ask a question and read the variants. Who bet the correct answer scores a point.

Winner is the one with the most points after the deck is exhausted.

136874.name: Giga Quiz: Pferde
136874.description:
With over 250 questions and answers about horses, additional Joker and booster cards that affect the course of the game, provide games and guessing fun with the Giga-effect.

There are questions one side and 4 variants another side of the card. Draw a card, ask a question and read the variants. Who bet the correct answer scores a point.

Winner is the one with the most points after the deck is exhausted.

136875.name: Fighter Wing / TFX
136875.description:
User Summary

A compilation CD containing two flight simulators: Fighter Wing from Merit Software and TFX from Ocean.

136876.name: Vakantielandenspel: Frankrijk
136876.description:
Name translates to 'Highlights of the Game: France', part of a series of such games with different countries being the subject.

This is a game where you can show off your knowledge of France by answering questions on History, Art, Culture, Sport and Food.By answering questions correctly, and with a little luck, you will collect souvenirs of the country.

The game consists of 48 question cards, 30 souvenir cards, one round ard, 1 rules card and 1 pamphlet with informative background information about your holiday destination.

On each card there are questions in 5 categories and each is designated with its own icon and colour. The five categories in full are;
Eten en Drinken (Green) - Eating and Drinking
Geschiedenis (Yellow) - History
Sport, Spel en Vakantie (Orange) - Sport, Games and Holidays
Kunst en Cultuur (Red) - Art and Culture
Stad en Land (Blue) - Cities and Countries

On each card the category questions are in a different order. On the back of each card are the answers. You play in rounds. The Round Card is placed on the bottom of the deck. You start with the first question on the card you have just drawn. If the Round Card is on the top of the deck, you put it back on the bottom and then ask the second question, and so on until 6 rounds have been played. On the question cards there are also commands, recognizable because the icon box is blank. These commands are on the lines of "Change a Souvenir to a different colour, Lose a souvenir, and so on.

The Question reader is the player to the left of the player whose turn it is. If the question is answered correctly, the player receives a souvenir in the same category of the question. If the player answers incorrectly then that player must lose a souvenir (if he has one) in that category. The question card is then placed on the bottom of the stack and the turn passes to the next player in a clockwise direction.

Maximum number Souvenirs
The number of souvenirs that a player may have in a category is a a maximum of '2 players - 3', '3 or 4 players - 2'.. If a player gets a question in the category of which he already has reached the maximum, then he can choose a souvenir of any other category if he answers correctly. At the end of your turn you can exchange any 2 matching souvenir cards for one in any other category.

The winner is the first player to get souvenirs in all 5 categories

136877.name: Fleet Defender: Scenario
136877.description:
User Summary

This expansion disk for Fleet Defender adds six new campaigns, two new theaters (Korean Peninsula and Indian Ocean), Pacific Fleet F-14 squadrons and a Mission Builder.

136878.name: Fleet Defender Gold
136878.description:
User Summary

A compilation combining Fleet Defender and the Fleet Defender: Scenario expansion disk on CD-ROM.

136879.description:
Lądowa Obrona Wybrzeża (Land Coastal Command) expands Pomorze 1939 and simulates the defence of the Polish coastal line during the early stages of World War II.

Two scenarios are included:
1) The historical one - simulating the German attack
2) "White Eagle" - simulating a hypothetical Polish preventive offensive launched on August 25.

The expansion uses the rulebook and some of the counters from the basic game but rules are added for Mława 1939 - panic and disorganization.

A full map of the Polish coast and two sheets of counters are included.


First published in the Polish magazine "Dragon hobby" in 1998 (1/98) and republished in Taktyka i Strategia issue 29 in 2009.

Wikipedia: Land Coastal Defence
136879.name: Lądowa Obrona Wybrzeża 1939

136880.name: Flight Light
136880.description:
Flight Light emphasizes giving the user a structured introduction to flight as well as visual cues to aid in learning procedures and navigation.

Source: The Publisher Website.

User Summary

This introductory civilian flight simulator allows you to pilot a Cessna CitationJet in the Chicago area. A campaign mode allows you to fly a series of increasingly challenging missions.

136881.name: TI-99
136881.description:
From The Texas Instruments TI-99/4A was an early home computer, released in June 1981, originally at a price of USD $525. It was an enhanced version of the less-successful—and quite rare—TI-99/4 model, which was released in late 1979 at a price of $1,150. The TI-99/4A added an additional graphics mode, "lowercase" characters consisting of small capitals, and a full travel keyboard. Its predecessor, the TI-99/4, featured a calculator-style chiclet keyboard and a unique style of ASCII that lacked lowercase text.

Source: Wikipedia, "TI99", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

136882.name: TRS-80 Color Computer
136882.description:
Tandy announced the TRS-80 Color Computer on July 31, 1980. The initial model (catalog number 26-3001) shipped with 4K of Dynamic Random Access Memory (DRAM) and an 8k Microsoft BASIC interpreter in ROM. Its price was $399. Within a few months, Radio Shack stores across the US and Canada began receiving and selling the new computer.

Despite bearing the TRS-80 name, the "Color Computer" was a radical departure from earlier TRS-80 Models - in particular it had a Motorola 6809E processor, rather than the TRS-80's Zilog Z80.

The Motorola 6809E was a very advanced processor, but was correspondingly more expensive than other more popular microprocessors. Competing machines such as the Apple II, Commodore VIC-20, the Commodore 64, the Atari 400, and the Atari 800 were designed around a combination of the much cheaper MOS 6502, itself essentially an enhanced clone of the Motorola 6800.

The CoCo lacked some of the graphics and sound capabilities of other home computers, but made up for it in computing power and ease of programming in BASIC. Combined with the versatile BASIC, the robust, easy-to-interface-to design has long made it an experimenter's favorite. Enthusiasts have continued to affectionately tinker with the "CoCo" to the present day.

Source: Wikipedia, "TRS-80 Color Computer", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

136883.name: Flight Light Plus
136883.description:
Flight Light Plus emphasizes giving the user a structured introduction to flight as well as visual cues to aid in learning procedures and navigation.

Source: The Publisher Website.

User Summary

Flight Light Plus was an expanded follow-up to Flight Light. This introductory civilian flight simulator allows you to fly various aircraft through a series of increasingly challenging missions. Five aircraft are simulated: Cessna CitationJet, Beechcraft Bonanza, Mooney 201, Piper Archer and Cessna 172.

136884.name: Precision Approach
136884.description:
Back of Box

The Task

Mission Control has just informed you everything's "nominal" as you approach the HAC. Suddenly, oboard cues indicate the speedbrake has failed to open. You realize immediate adjustments are required to achieve a successful landing. Will you be able to compensate in time? Experience the thrill of landing the Space Shuttle Columbia at the Kennedy Space Center in Florida! Take over the manual control at Mach 1 and glide the orbiter to a successful landing...but remember, you only get one chance!

The Experience

Fly the most accurate simulation of Shuttle Guidance, Navigation, Control & Aerodynamics available. Apply working, realistic critical entry flight instruments and pilot aids. Experience detailed day and night visual scenes of the Cape Canaveral area from inside the orbiter or as a NASA "Chase Plane" pilot. Recreate the same unexpected approaches for which astronauts train thousands of hours. Listen to realistic cockpit and air-to-ground voice traffic. Relive your successes and failures with the postflight playback capability.

136885.name: Hi-Tech Missions
136885.description:
User Summary

A compilation CD containing the jet combat simulator TFX and the Space Shuttle landing simulator Precision Approach.

136886.name: JetFighter: Full Burn
136886.description:
Back of Box

It's the year 2006 and an enourmous oil reserve has been discovered in the Barents Sea near the Russian-Norwegian border. Norway lays claim to the territory and begins deep-sea drilling in the region, despite the outcries of the bankrupt Russian government.

Against his government's wishes, General Alexander Krugov leads a rebel secessionist movement on a bold plan of action designed to jump-start the Russian economy: they will send their Rapid Response Unit into the Barents Sea to lay claim to the Norwegian oil sites. Krugov's gambit will throw the world into war, and the deadliest modern air battle ever witnessed will erupt between the United States Navy and the Russian Air Force.


The next-generation flight simulation in the critically acclaimed JetFighter series



Two games in one: fight for the U.S. or the Russians in two extensive campaigns



Three cutting-edge aircraft: the F/A-18 and F-22N for the U.S. and the MiG-42 stealth fighter for the Russians



High-production cinematic sequences featuring rich characters and engaging story lines from both sides of the conflict



Accurate geographical realism generated from government topographical data



Network play allows you to test your combat skills against your friends

136887.name: Zombie Enclave
136887.description:
Game Description

Zombie Enclave (ZE) is a free, solitaire game of survival on a Earth dominated by Zombies: while designed as a solitaire game you can easily play ZE with two (multiplayer rules are included).

The focus of the game is the Refuge (the Enclave in the game title), the place where you're trying to defend yourself from the zombie attacks, accumulating enough resources in order to gain some additional weeks of life.

You start the game with a very simple, undefended Refuge and then you will have to plan how to protect your Survivors by adding the many "defenses" available. "Defenses" can be holes, wall reinforcements, explosive barrels, traps and so on: the idea is to replicate the full spectrum of iconic scenes seen in the zombie movies. The game sequence can then be summarized as: gain new resources, spend resources to improve your Refuge, wait for the enemy attack.

Zombies will be managed with a "buildup pool": every turn you draw a buildup chit and apply the results (normally new zombies arriving) while an "Attack!" marker will initiate the combat.

During combat the zombies will move from the upper part of the map (the external defenses) toward your Refuge: the Defenses will try to slow and/or damage the zombies but it's up to the Survivors to close the fight.

In terms of rules, the game will include a set of Standard Rules, with basic tasks and a good set of available resources to start with. Several scenarios will make possible a quick start of the game with not only your Refuge, but also an external defensive wall and a bunch of resource points that you can spend during setup to prepare your initial defenses.

Advanced rules will add more details (like Vehicles and Events), and finally the Campaign game will make possible to start really from zero, with just you and Soldier, your invaluable dog.

boardgamehonor: 2013 Golden Geek Best Card Game Nominee
2013 International Gamers Award - General Strategy: Multi-player Nominee
2013 Meeples' Choice Nominee
2013 Spiel der Spiele Hit mit Freunden Recommended
2013 Spiel des Jahres Kennerspiel des Jahres Nominee
2014 Lys Passioné Finalist
2014 Nederlandse Spellenprijs Best Expert Game Nominee
136888.description:
Bruges in the 15th century – culture and commerce flourish and make the Belgian Hanseatic city into one of the wealthiest cities in Europe.

In Bruges (a.k.a. Brugge or Brügge depending on the country in which you live), players assume the role of merchants who must maintain their relationships with those in power in the city while competing against one another for influence, power, and status. Dramatic events cast their shadows over the city, with players needing to worry about threats to their prosperity from more than just their opponents...

The game includes 165 character cards, with each card having one of five colors. On a turn, a player chooses one of his cards and performs an action, with six different actions being available: Take workers, take money, mitigate a threat, build a canal, build a house, or hire the character depicted on the card. In principle, every card can be used for every action – but the color of the card determines in which areas the actions can be used or the strength of the chosen action, e.g., blue cards provide blue workers and red cards help mitigate red threats. All of the action is geared toward the gathering of prestige, with the most prestigious merchant winning in the end.

136889.name: KA-50 Hokum
136889.description:
Back of Box

Every day in the South China Sea up to 200 ships slow to as little as 15 knots to pass through sea-lanes less than a mile wide ... leaving them open to attack from pirates. Valuable cargo is constantly stolen. Sometimes lives and whole ships are taken. Understandably, not everyone is happy about the situation. Some corporations are prepared to spend vast sums of money employing people to protect their investment.

People like you.

From Simis, the team behind the critically acclaimed AV-8B Harrier Assault, comes a simulation of phenomenal proportions. Fly four of the world's most advanced helicopters...

The Kamov Werewolf KA-50 Hokum
The Kamov HIP HI-8
The Bell Super Cobra AH-1W
The Westland Army Lynx

... each one simulated to an unprecedented degree of realism with solid texture-mapped detail and authentic flight models tested and approved by experienced pilots. Take advantage of the unique two-player co-pilot feature, and the most advanced strategic battle-planning system ever implemented in a combat simulation. Spectacular camera views bring to life the full explosive impact of combat in the air and over Gouraud-shaped terrain. But do you have the nerve and ability to command a four-strong fleet and wage war against the pirate armies?

136890.description:
HOLD THE LINE comes to the wars of Europe in the Age of Reason with FREDERICK’S WAR. When Frederick II led his army into Silesia a long duel began between a still fragile Prussia and the first class power that was Austria. Featured here are eight battles from the fearsome contest: Mollwitz, Choutusitz, Hohenfriedburg, Kesseldorf, Kolin, Leuthen, Hochkirk, and Liegnitz. The game closely aligns with the Hold the Line system, but includes more advanced command rules, more detailed cavalry rules, optional rules for each warring nation’s units, and much more.


The Prussian army is well drilled and led by a bevy of talented generals, including Schwerin, Zieten, Leopold von Dessau, and of course Frederick the Great. The Austrian army is slightly weaker, but is aided by fearsome light infantry units and in later scenarios are led by such capable commanders as Daun and Loudon.
As Prussia can you humble the Austrians and make your kingdom a first-class power? As Austria can you weather the Prussian storm and halt the first steps towards decline? The enemy approaches, the sound of cannon deafens, men shout commands, smoke fills the air. You must HOLD THE LINE!

For each scenario each player receives a number of command points to activate the units in his army for movement, close assault, and fire combat. Each side also receives a random number of command points for the same, but never knowing how many creating a battle field chaos that makes the game highly replayable. Scenarios take approximately 1 hour to play so you can get in multiple plays in an evening.
136890.name: Hold the Line:  Frederick's War

videogame: ATAC: The Secret War Against Drugs
136891.name: Mile High Club
videogamecompilation: ATAC: The Secret War Against Drugs
136891.description:
User Summary

An eight CD compilation pack featuring flight simulation and space combat games.

136893.name: Microsoft Flight Simulator 5.0
videogameexpansion: Japan Scenery Enhancement for Microsoft Flight Simulator
New York Scenery Enhancement for Microsoft Flight Simulator
136893.description:
Flight Simulator 5 (FS5), released in 1993, was the last DOS-only release in the popular Microsoft Flight Simulator series which began in 1982.

FS5 marked a significant change in that it was the first version of the series to use textures. While this allowed FS5 to achieve a much higher degree of realism than the previous flat-shaded simulators, it also resulted in all add-on scenery and aircraft for the previous versions obsolete.

Other noticeable improvements included the use of digital audio for sound effects, custom cockpits for each aircraft (previous versions had a generic cockpit that was slightly modified to fit various aircraft), and overall improved graphics.

FS5 also featured:


Expanded bundled scenery (now including parts of Europe)



Improvements to: modeling of the included aircraft, weather system's realism and artificial intelligence


Source: Wikipedia, "History of Microsoft Flight Simulator", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

136894.name: Microsoft Flight Simulator 5.1
videogameexpansion: Japan Scenery Enhancement for Microsoft Flight Simulator
New York Scenery Enhancement for Microsoft Flight Simulator
136894.description:
Flight Simulator 5 (FS5), released in 1993, was the last DOS-only release in the popular Microsoft Flight Simulator series which began in 1982.

FS5 marked a significant change in that it was the first version of the series to use textures. While this allowed FS5 to achieve a much higher degree of realism than the previous flat-shaded simulators, it also resulted in all add-on scenery and aircraft for the previous versions obsolete.

Other noticeable improvements included the use of digital audio for sound effects, custom cockpits for each aircraft (previous versions had a generic cockpit that was slightly modified to fit various aircraft), and overall improved graphics.

In 1995, Flight Simulator 5.1 was introduced. It was the first version of the series to be released on CD-ROM. Changes included the ability to handle scenery libraries (including wide use of satellite imagery), faster performance and a barrage of true-to-life weather effects: storms, 3D clouds and fog.

Fans of the program generated a huge amount of custom "freeware" was created for FS5.1. Utility programs from Microsoft and third-parties allowed new aircraft, cockpits and airports to be created and added.

Source: Wikipedia, "History of Microsoft Flight Simulator", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

136895.name: New York Scenery Enhancement for Microsoft Flight Simulator
136895.description:
User Summary

New York scenery pack for Microsoft Flight Simulator 5.

136896.name: Japan Scenery Enhancement for Microsoft Flight Simulator
136896.description:
User Summary

Japan scenery pack for Microsoft Flight Simulator 5. Includes famous landmarks and cities of Japan as well as islands that form the Pacific Rim of Japan.

136897.name: Orbital (iOS)
136897.description:
A simple puzzle game for all with beautiful visual effects, it can be played in short sessions and is highly addictive.

You must shoot orbs into a grid with your cannon. The orb you fired will expand until it touches a wall or another orb. Each orb contains the number ‘3’, which decreases by one every time it is hit. After 3 hits they explode and you earn a point. The game could be endless… There is just one condition: a shot orb must not touch the death line above the cannon! If it does, the game is over.

A simple concept to rack your brains and nerves.

Source: The Developer Website.

136898.name: EF2000 TACTCOM Tactical and Communications Upgrade
136898.description:
User Summary

The TACTCOM expansion for EF 2000 adds a number of new features and upgrades to the flight sim. Network multiplayer capability is available through IPX, direct connection or modem. Players can now use the tactical mission planner to plot their own missions within a campaign. Other enhancements include air traffic control, enhanced AI driven cameras, new map types and new instrumentation.

136899.name: Top Gun: Fire at Will
136899.description:
Back of Box

Bogeys inbound...

Permission to engage!

The popular Top Gun movie set a new standard for extraordinary high-flying excitement. Now the story continues with Top Gun: Fire at Will! In this fast and furious action flying game, YOU are Maverick. The action begins at Top Gun School, where you compete for the coveted Top Gun trophy. Live-action video creates the experience of a lifetime as you battle your way through an epic adventure set against a backdrop of burgeoning global crisis. Experience the ultimate that modern dogfighting has to offer as you lead your wingmen into fierce aerial combat.


Live actors, including the return of James Tolkan in the role of "Hondo," Maverick's tough, cigar-chompin' Commanding Officer.



Your backseater Merlin flies with you on every mission calling the shots and helping you be the best of the best.



Over 40 missions to fly with increasing levels of difficulty. Or choose Instant Action and prepare for immediate combat.



Choose your friend as your wingman or your opponent with head-to-head network play.

136900.name: Twin Calibre: F29 Retaliator; The Heroes of the 357th
136900.description:
User Summary

A CD-ROM compilation of the jet fighter simulation F29 Retaliator and the WWII air combat simulation The Heroes of the 357th.

136901.name: Marine Fighters
136901.description:
Back of Box

Going vertical!

Vertical take off and landing: the revolutionary technology that changed air warfare forever. Experience the extreme agility and destructive firepower of the most advanced VTOL warplanes. An expansion disc to the ground breaking U.S. Navy Fighters, Marine Fighters adds an entirely new dimension to white-knuckled dogfighting.

New features for U.S. Navy Fighters:


Faster frame rates
Terrain masking
Low level buffeting and turbulence
Tour of duty summary with hit percentages, kills and decorations


Three revolutionary aircraft: Night Attack Harrier II, FRS.Mk 2 Sea Harrier, and the Russian Yak-141. Featuring highly realistic VTOL flight models.

On station: Fly Harriers off the deck of the Navy's brand new Amphibious Assault Ship - the U.S.S. Wasp.

Island Warfare: Engage in 35 all new missions to retake Japan's Kuril Islands from elite Russian air and sea forces.

New Weapons: Load up even more firepower including LAU rockets, Snakeye retarded bombs, and 30mm gun pods.

Realistic terrain: Fly over fully texture mapped islands based on aerial and satellite photography.

Enhanced special effects: Experience low level turbulence, new maneuvers for enemy pilots, and faster frame rates.

Control a Marine Air Wing: Manage a supply of combat aircraft and weapons during the campaign to retake the Kurils.

New vehicles: Rip into enemy forces with 105mm howitzers, 40mm and 25mm rapid fire cannons in the AC-130U Spectre gunship.

Terrain masking: Dive behind hills and mountains to dodge missiles and break enemy radar locks.

Aces high: New tour of duty feature keeps track of your kills and combat statistics.

136902.description:
From the webside:
Don’t be sheepish! The Wolf Booster Deck adds even more wolfish mischief to this quick playing game of interactive strategy.

With the wolf-card every player has more chances to move the wolf in the game.
136902.name: Sheepdogs of Pendleton Hill: The Wolf Booster Deck

136903.name: Werewolf vs. Comanche
136903.description:
Back of Box

The most dangerous game

Sometimes your best friends can be your worst enemies.

Especially when they're behind the controls of a Russian Werewolf or American RAH-66 Comanche helicopter and it's your tail they're after.

With two killer CD games in one box, and the crystal clear reality of Voxel Space, you can fly solo or feel the blood curdling thrill of head-to-head combat or all-out team warfare.

Werewolf vs. Comanche features:


Ready to Go! Modem, Network and Direct Connect capabilities.



Head-to-Head, Team (cooperative) or Solo game play.



Over 100 missions



Features NovaLogic's Voxel Space (patent pending) technology which gives 500 times more detail than traditional 3-D games. Includes haze, shadows, reflective water, and a 3-D weather model.



29 Voxel Space, 3-D terrains with translucent smoke and ground debris. Looks to real it hurts!



Helipads where you can refuel, repair your damage and replenish your ammunition.



Feel the unique flight dynamics of each helicopter.



New targets and enemies.



Grippingly stunning animation sequences.



Multi-channel digital sound.

136904.name: Sega CD
136904.description:
The Sega Mega-CD (メガCD Mega Shī Dī) (released as the Sega CD in North America) is an add-on device for the Sega Mega Drive/Genesis video game console, designed and produced by Sega. The device adds a CD-ROM drive to the console, allowing the user to play CD-based games and providing additional hardware functionality. It can also play audio CDs and CD+G discs.

Source: Wikipedia, "Sega Mega-CD", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

136905.name: 747-400 Precision Simulator
136905.description:
The Precision Simulator 1.x series, also known as "PS1", is being developed in cooperation with 747-400 experts from all over the world. The latest version, 1.3, surpasses, by far, all previous updates. PS1's user base ranges from leading airlines, NASA research centers, universities, to pilots of all categories who use PS1 during their transition training to "glass" or, regularly, at home, as a refresher. Also, students who want to be prepared for airline interviews and sim checks, instructors who "test-fly" new scenarios on the PC before going into the full-flight sims, maintenance specialists, Human Factors labs, avionics designers, flight dispatchers, air traffic controllers and many other aviation professionals rank among PS1's user base since its introduction in 1997.

The PS1 concept resembles that of a full-flight simulator rather than that of a conventional "one-topic-at-a-time" CBT station. Whether you're practising IFR procedures using the FMC and EFIS tools, or playing "what if" with the hydraulics, electrics, pneumatics, etc., all system simulations are permanently interacting with each other and may develop into enormously complex situations.

- Complete Autopilot / Flight Director mode logic and accurate Thrust Management System.
- Simulation of the entire 744 FMC: HOLD, VNAV, FORECAST, OFFPATH DES, FIX INFO, All INIT/REF pages, LEGS, RTE DATA, WINDS, ROUTE 1 & 2, DEP/ARR, PROGRESS, etc. All pages are fully functioning.
- IFR Training on “glass”. All EFIS symbols are being generated, e. g. Trend Vector, Energy Management Circles, Offset Route, Fix Info etc., incl. Failure Flags.
- Highly accurate aerodynamics simulation. Exact 744 pitch/power/path and fuel flow ratios etc.
- Precise and highly detailed Systems Simulations: Electrical, Hydraulics, Fire & Ice Protection, Gear & Flight Controls incl. alternate controls, Doors, EEC, IRS incl. alignment simulation and drift errors, Fuel System Management, Pneumatics, etc.
- Random or user defined malfunction scenarios.
- Fully functioning EICAS message logic with hundreds of alert, memo & status messages.
- Secondary EICAS: All Synoptics & Displays.
- Video recorder/player: Training videos may be created! Text bars and sounds can be added.
- TCAS (Traffic Alert & Collision Avoidance System) with authentic Resolution & Traffic Advisories. External traffic can be simulated to demonstrate the various aural and visual TCAS alerts and system logic.
- GPWS (Ground Proximity Warning System).
- The simulator can be switched to specific airline configurations. This affects engine types (GE, RR, P&W), fuel system, hydraulics and other aircraft systems, also EFIS/EICAS symbols (Cross-Bar or V-Bar Flight Director, TDZ etc.), GPWS sounds, as well as copilot call-outs.
- Weather generator: Fog, CBs, rain, windshears/microbursts, volcanic ash, ice and more.
- Flying area is the entire world (ca. 1500 runways).
- Navaid & airway world database by Swissair.
- Semi-random ATC model: Pushback, vectors, step climb & descent clearances, holdings etc. Different accents, recorded by real controllers.
- User programable ATC vectors scenarios.
- Copilot Simulations: Specific checklists & calls, recorded by 744 pilots of different airlines.
- Analysis functions: Take-off & approach profiles, and zoom-able track plotting across the world.
- Data output for external add-on programs.
- Comprehensive Operations Manual (English, 350 pages, robust glossy paper in sturdy wire binding).

Source: The Publisher Website.

136906.name: Out of Space
136906.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Out of Space contains five adventures that will take Investigators from the mountains of northern Mexico to the skies above Germany, to the smog and disease of gaslight London and the raging tides of the Atlantic Ocean. It will even take you to a world that could only exist in your worst nightmares.

Created GUMSHOE designer and gaming luminary, Robin D. Laws, Trail of Cthulhu veteran Adam Gauntlett, and Jason Morningstar, award-winning creator of Fiasco and the Shab-al-Hiri Roach, Out of Space features:


The Repairer of Reputations: A seemingly utopian future takes on a distinctly nightmarish quality. The scenario plays with this by suggesting that the publication of The King in Yellow has warped history. The alien beings described in the play are as real as the antagonists believe them to be.
Flying Coffins: Enemy planes are not the only things hunting in the sky. Winter, 1918. You are members of the Royal Flying Corps stationed near the Front and rumour has it, the next big push is about to begin. Meanwhile the new Hun Circus is racking up kill after kill – but is it the enemy or something else that’s to blame?
Many Fires: In the mountains of northern Mexico, something ancient and obscene lies smoldering among ruins older than the Aztecs. But here the problems are more modern – and they wear gun-belts. Do an unlikely band of Investigators have the courage to tackle Pancho Villa’s bandit army? And what will they do when the trail of clues takes them into dangerous territory they cannot even imagine?
Hell Fire: In the smog and grime of 18th century London, a great evil stirs. In the seedy underclass of the city a plague is taking hold. Its victims are under the sway of something far worse than they can imagine, an entity of disgusting power bent on engulfing the world in disease and death.
The Millionaire’s Special: First class on the Titanic is exciting in itself but when you’re invited to a private viewing of one of the world’s great curiosities, a cursed Egyptian mummy, things take a turn for the worse. Strange rituals, a device to contact spirits and the awakening of something ancient and evil mean that icebergs are not the only danger for RMS Titanic.


Out of Space also features extensive handouts, pregenerated characters and exclusive new essays from the authors.

136907.name: Against the Dark: The Transylvanian Tribunal
136907.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Between two empires is a land of high mountains and dark forests, of great rivers and fertile plains. The richest king in Mythic Europe rules Hungary, but his nobles are restless and the Teutonic Knights he invited to guard his borders want no overlord. Other small kingdoms play east and west against each other, tolerating heresy in their search for freedom. The mountains are the home of countless dragons, and vampires stalk the peasants in their villages. To the east, a greater storm gathers.

This is the Transylvanian Tribunal.

One force brings light to the darkness. Here, where a lord need not swear fealty for his land, the magi of the Order of Hermes may rule openly without violating the Code. Here, in the heartland of House Tremere, the gifts and talents of all magi may be brought together, to cooperate for the good of the world. Here can be seen the shape of the new order that the Tremere wish to bring.

Let us work together as one and grow hale and strong.

136908.name: FlipOver!
136908.description:
The Matching Game You'll Flip For!
In this fun matching game for 2-6 players, kids try to be first to get their animals into the barn! Players search their cards to complete an animal image, then use the Barnyard Flipper to reveal the next image to be matched. Play continues until all images have been matched and all animals are back in the barn!

136910.name: Roll & Play
136910.description:
Roll & Play is the first game ever designed specifically for toddlers! To play, simply toss the big plush cube and identify which colored side faces up. Choose a matching color card and perform the simple activity shown. “Make a happy face,” “Moo like a cow” the activities supported by Roll & Play are designed to help your child shine, supporting healthy development and celebrating success! Roll & Play is the ideal way to gently introduce play patterns and rules through a loving, joyful play experience!

As this is a game primarily aimed at the 3-and-under set, the goal of the game is for a personal best of completing activity cards.

136912.name: Los Incognitos: Alien iacta est
136912.description:
Los Incognitos: Alien iacta est is a dice game in which the players try to track down as many extraterrestrial time travelers as possible. The players roll their dice as long as it is possible to carry out at least one of four possible actions. Except from storing a maximum of two dice, the players can walk or fly through different eras of human history in search of alien visitors. They receive points for monsters they have marked and also for sites they have explored. After a certain number of rounds, the most successful monster tracker as determined by the number of points wins.

The mechanisms of Los Incognitos: Alien iacta est are based upon those of Expedition Sumatra: Dadu Dadu, but in addition to the different theme, there are new scenarios on bigger boards with optional rule extensions. The game offers four scenarios varying in complexity, each set in another era of human history.

136913.name: Fly Fu Pro
136913.description:
The most amazing adventure a fly can ever have! Fly Fu Pro is a classic beat'em up game with adventure, role playing, puzzle and strategic elements available on iPhone and iPad.

Help Monthy McFly on his mission to save his kidnapped girlfriend, Kate Moth. Fly on a leaf above the suburban area and collect buttons for a Teddy Bear, help the scientist ladybugs finish their 'Juggernaut' project, storm a stage performance, afterwards make it through the angered fans' crowd and most importantly: reveal the darkest secrets of the evil spideress queen, Ebony Overseer!

The game features:
- unique style of art based on Magnus Muhr's 'Dead fly art'
- 10 different weapons to use (5 melee weapons, 5 projectiles)
- 4 different styled mini-games to put your skills to the test
- survival mode to test your endurance
- 24 skills to learn - to name a few: fire-breath, life leeching and turning your character into stone
- 20+ species of insects to fight against, including explosive jawbreaker spiders

Source: The Developer Website.

136914.description:
Munchkin Bookmark Collection contains twenty four Munchkin bookmark and twenty nine bookmarks for the Munchkin Sequel games Each bookmark provides a unique in-game action.

The bookmarks included in the Munchkin Bookmark Collection are:

The Official Munchkin Cheesy Promotional Bookmark of Power
The Official Munchkin Bookmark of Dark Vileness!
The Official Munchkin Bookmark of Clerical Erroneousness!
The Official Munchkin Bookmark of Buried Treasure
The Official Munchkin Bookmark of Arranged Dearangement
The Official Munchkin Bookmark of Dungeon Meistery
The Official Munchkin Bookmark of Sparkly Good Monster Mayhem
The Official Munchkin Bookmark of Holiday Cheer!
The Official Munchkin Bookmark of Stocking Unstuffing
The Official Munchkin Bookmark of BRAAAAAAAAAINS!
The Official Munchkin Jumbo D6 Bookmark of Hexahedral Retrieval!
The Official Munchkin Bookmark of Board Game Geekery!
The Official Munchkin Bookmark of Boom and Bust!
The Official Munchkin Bookmark of Funko Funtimes!
The Official Munchkin Bookmark of Might Fine Bonuses!
The Official Munchkin Smashup Bookmark of Smashking Success!
The Official Munchkin Bookmark for Internationals TableTop Day!
The Official Munchkin Bookmark of Bargain Hunting.
The Official Steve Jackson Munchkin Bookmark of The Big Box of Beatdown!
The Official John Kovalic Munchkin Bookmark of Draw, Draw Again!
The Official Phil Reed Munchkin Bookmark of Battlegrip Action!
The Official Andrew Hackard Munchkin Bookmark of The Red Pen of Dooooom!
The Official Leonard Balsera Munchkin Bookmart of Mindless Escapism!




The bookmarks included in the The Good, The Bad, and The Munchkin are:

The Official Munchkin Bookmark of Gol-Darned Gunslinging
The Official Munchkin Bookmark of Calvary Charges!




The bookmarks included in the Munchkin Apocalypse are:

The Official Munchkin Bookmark of Bookmark of Re-Sealing!
The Official Munchkin Bookmark of The Ladies of Ragnarok!




The bookmarks included in the Munchkin Bites! are:

The Official Munchkin Bookmark of Powerful Empowerment.
The Official Munchkin Bookmark of Sloppy Summoning




The bookmarks included in the Munchkin Booty are:


The Official Munchkin Bookmark of Ship Shape Sailing
The Official Munchkin Bookmark of Soggy Smiting


The bookmarks included in the Munchkin Cthulhu are:


The Official Munchkin Bookmark of Esoteric Empowerment
The Official Munchkin Bookmark of Udder Ridculousness


The bookmarks included in the Munchkin Fu are:

The Official Munchkin Bookmark of Hong Kong Wrongness
The Official Munchkin Bookmark of Solemn Sagacity




The bookmarks included in the Munchkin Impossible are:


The Official Munchkin Bookmark of Her Majestry's Secret Circles


The bookmarks included in the Munchkin Legends are:


The Official Munchkin Bookmark of Hidden Lore


The bookmarks included in the Munchkin Zombies are:


The Official Munchkin Bookmark of Shelter Skelter


The bookmarks included in the Star Munchkin are:


The Official Munchkin Bookmark of Blatant Cheating!
The Official Munchkin Bookmark of Clown trooper Chaos!


The bookmarks included in the Super Munchkin are:


The Official Munchkin Bookmark of Winged Helmet of Swiftness
The Official Munchkin Bookmark of Well Dressed Hero


The bookmarks included in the Munchkin Adventure Time are:


The Official Munchkin Bookmark of Adventure Time!


The bookmarks included in the Munchkin Axe Cop are:


The Official Munchkin Bookmark of Chopping off Heads!
The Official Munchkin Bookmark of Random Axe of Kindness!


The bookmarks included in the Munchkin Conan are:

The Official Munchkin Bookmark of Barbaric Bludgeoning!




The bookmarks included in the Munchkin Pathfinder are:

The Official Munchkin Bookmark of Goblin Turkey!




The bookmarks included in the Munchkin Quest are:

The Official Munchkin Bookmark of Bimodal Bifurcation
The Official Munchkin Bookmark of Portal Respawning
The Official Munchkin Bookmark of Surprising Survival




The bookmarks included in the Munchkin Treasure Hunt are:


The Official Munchkin Bookmark of Ultimate Magic!
136914.name: Munchkin Bookmark Collection

136916.name: Airline Simulator
136916.description:
Excerpts from Publisher Press Release

LAGO is proud to announce that, thanks to an agreement with subLOGIC, LAGO is allowed to include parts of the famous Airline Transport Pilot (ATP) simulator in their upcoming products.

Airline Simulator (AS) includes:


747-400 airplane with the original subLOGIC flight model;



European Scenery;



The scenery is completed with more than 300 secondary airports - with a total of more than 700 runways - in the European territory, and the overseas airports of Boston (USA) and Toronto (Canada). All the necessary navaids are also included. You will be able to fly for the first time ever in real-time-continuos flights between New York (and the other US/Canada airports) and all the European airports: prepare your coffee mugs!;



A special 747-400 adapted version of the glass cockpit found in the 3D Advanced Graphic System (3DAGS) package, running at 640x400 resolution at 256 colours; the glass cockpit is redesigned with the typical Boeing colors and includes full instrumentation support on the secondary panel for the four engines;



3DAGS world-wide famous 3D drivers (to take full advantage of them you should use the special 3D Glasses sold separately).

136917.name: Airline Simulator 2
136917.description:
Only flying the real aircraft is more realistic

Enjoy the most realistic aircraft handling ever achieved on a PC based flight simulation with the totally rewritten flight models of MD-83, MD-88 and B747-400.
