Three years of research result in highly sophisticated flight equations based on true inertia system, true airflow calculations, detailed calculations of forces even down to tyre deformations, that warrant an astonishingly realistic behaviour of the airplane, both in ground and airborne handling. Revised atmosphere and grossly enhanced weather effects like wind turbulence, rain, snow as well as runway surface calculation allow realistic ground handling in steady or gusty crosswind, taking into account dry, wet, snowy or icy runways. Explore the edges of the airplane envelope ... Want to see, whether you can loop or roll your favourite airliner? Good luck! Stress calculations will give you an idea when your aircraft disintegrates in the air - however, aircraft will maintain flyable, but you will need to deal with asymmetric lift, asymmetric drag, flamed out engines and much more, if you overstress the airframe, as you may loose parts of your wings, slats, flaps, tailplane or cause engine failures. Touch down hard, and experience the skidding experience with a partly collapsed gear.

Aircraft Abstraction layer, short AAL, the technology behind the new flight model, makes flying easy, as airplanes are designed to be flown by average pilots, and teaches the right, real world handling techniques used by real world pilots. Be ahead of your airplane, that's the key to success in flying your aircraft - the inertia of the plane now forces you to think ahead of your airplane, just as real aircraft do.

And of course, who wants to fly the famous Dumbo will be able to do so, too.

AS2 features all systems, that the handling pilot will have to deal with, including fully featured Autopilot and Main Control Panel (MCP), Flight Management Computer (FMS), Thrust Computer, Ground Proximity Warning System (GPWS), Traffic and Collision Avoidance System (TCAS) and many more systems. The handling Pilot will be relieved from handling other systems by the virtual first officer, who therefore takes care your workload as flying pilot will not become critical - as in the real plane.

Aural Alarms (e.g. GPWS, TCAS, configuration alarms), voice communication with the first officer and improved sounds for touch down, stall warning and other aircraft related sounds have been implemented using real world sounds.

AS2 comes with a 300 pages manual in printed form (150 pages thereof being reproductions of Aerad Airport and ILS charts), teaching all relevant methods of handling an airplane, not only in windless situations, but crosswind, gusty winds, windshear and all levels of turbulences, that make an ILS approach in clouds really demanding. In addition three reproductions of Aerad enroute charts covering Europe and North Atlantic come with AS2, as well as laminated checklists for the MD-83, MD-88 and B744.

AS2 comes as a stand alone package with an easy installation under DOS and Win95/98/ME.

Source: The Publisher Website.

136918.name: Combat Aces
136918.description:
User Summary

A two game combat flight simulator compilation CD.

136919.name: Conquer the Skies
136919.description:
User Summary

A compilation of four flight simulators.

136920.name: Jet Stream
136920.description:
User Summary

A Japanese civil flight simulator. Fly an Airbus A320 airliner or a Fuji FA-200 Aero Subaru light-plane around Japan. Each aircraft uses a customized instrument panel and you can choose from a pilot's or co-pilot's view. Depart and land at the following airports: Haneda, Narita, Itami, Kansai, Nagoya and New Chitose, Fukuoka and Kumamoto.

136921.name: DARK
136921.description:
The game follows the story of Eric Bane, a newly turned vampire suffering from amnesia. He learns that his transformation is not complete and that, if he does not drink the blood of his sire, he will mutate into a mindless ghoul. In order to avoid being such a foul creature, he receives missions to drink ancient vampires' blood. However, an angel in Eric's view appears to guide him to the righteous path, and ease intolerable pain that comes from not drinking appropriate blood as it disappears. With a question of this vision, he tries to recover his deleted memories and his true-self 'vampire'.

Source: Wikipedia, "Dark (video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

136922.name: Jet Stream 2nd Approach
136922.description:
User Summary

The second entry in the long-running Japanese civil flight simulator series. In addition to the Airbus A320 and Fuji FA-200 Aero Subaru offered in the first game, Jet Stream 2 also allows you to fly three Boeing airliners: the 747-400, 767-200 and 777-200. Graphics have also been improved from the original.

The simulation is still set in Japan, but 35 airports are provided (as compared to 8 in the first Jet Stream). Distinct instrument panels are use for the FA-200, Airbus and Boeing aircraft.

136923.name: Divinity: Original Sin
videogamehonor: 2014 Golden Geek Most Innovative Video Game Nominee
2014 The Game Awards Best Role Playing Game of the Year Nominee
2015 D.I.C.E. Role-Playing Game of the Year Nominee
2015 SXSW Best Crowdfunded Game of the Year Nominee
136923.description:
Divinity: Original Sin is a single-player and cooperative multiplayer fantasy role-playing video game by Larian Studios. The game ships with the editor that it was created with, allowing players to create their own single-player and multiplayer adventures, and publish them online. The game was funded through Kickstarter and is a prequel to Divine Divinity.

Gameplay

Original Sin is the latest RPG in the Divinity universe. Divinity: Original Sin concerns two heroes: a condemned warrior released from his chains and a mystic heroine restored to life. The game touts turn-based combat, cooperative multiplayer, a highly interactive world and will ship with a full-fledged modding tool.

Source: Wikipedia, "Divinity: Original Sin", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

136924.name: Edge of Twilight: Return to Glory
136924.description:
User Summary

Edge of Twilight features a steampunk fantasy world in which day and night are inhabited by completely different civilizations. Lex is a half-breed who can bridge the gap between the realms of darkness and light and is able to switch between both day and night, changing up the gameplay and Lex's appearance.

136925.name: JetFighter III Enhanced Campaign CD
136925.description:
Box Text

Adds 5 million square miles and 70 missions to the original JetFighter III.

Lead a team of the world's top pilots on missions against China's invasion of Russia and North Korea, and Eastern Russia's territorial dispute with Alaska.

Global peace through deadly force

Unsurpassed Jetfighter III features


Now fly the F-14 Tomcat. Also includes the F-22N Lightning II and the F/A-18 Hornet.



New special effects technology: TEXTUREAL and 3DNA Sequencing -- interlinks realistic 3D landscape features to accurately model spectacular and diverse scenery.



Unlimited views: Virtual cockpit featuring 360 degree 3D viewing -- plus missile-cam, padlock view and programmable camera angles.



Incredibly accurate texture mapping -- for intense feeling of flight and sensation of speed.



Wingmen at your command assist in dogfights against lethal enemy intelligence.



Still the easiest-to-use flight simulator!


- 5 Million sq. miles of real-world 3D terrain added: Combined with the original JF3 scenery, now there's more than 8 million sq. miles to explore.

- Full arsenal of hi-tech weapons: Including: Sidewinders, AMRAAMs, Mk82 bombs, Vulcan cannons, laser-guided Mavericks and newly added Phoenix missiles.

- Over 70 new missions: Fly interactive missions over diverse regions including China, Korea, Japan, Russia and Alaska.

- Detailed scenery and special effects: Including thousands of buildings, towers, airports, rivers & more -- plus dynamic time-of-day effects, fire, smoke and transparent clouds.

136926.name: Kingdom Hearts HD 1.5 ReMIX
videogamefranchise: Greatest Hits (Best Selling PlayStation Games, US)
136926.description:
Kingdom Hearts HD 1.5 Remix includes both Kingdom Hearts Final Mix and Re:Chain of Memories in high-definition and with trophy support. Additionally, the collection features Kingdom Hearts 358/2 Days in a Theater Mode, spanning 2 hours and 50 minutes of HD remastered cinematics from the original game, as well as new scenes. The 358/2 Days cinematic also has trophy support.

Source: Wikipedia, "https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kingdom_Hearts_HD_1.5_Remix&qu...;, available under the CC-BY-SA License.

136927.name: JetFighter III Platinum Edition
136927.description:
User Summary

A compilation combining JetFighter III and the Enhanced Campaign CD with additional all-new content.

The Platinum Edition also adds a mission editor; additional missions and campaigns; and new scenery, features and effects. As if that's not enough, you also get a free JetFighter III t-shirt to boot.

136928.name: Werewolf
136928.description:
Box Descriptions

The most dangerous game

Fly the Werewolf - the most advanced, efficient, single-seated attack helicopter in the world. The Russian machine has amazing structural strength, unique agility and enough firepower to terrify any adversary.

Werewolf features:

30 solo missions

30 Head to Head missions with Multiplayer capabilities

Features NovaLogic's Voxel Space technology which gives 500 times more detail than traditional 3-D games. Includes haze, shadows, reflective water.

Helipads where you can refuel, repair your damage and replenish your ammunition.

Multi-channel digital sound.

Modem, Network and Direct Connect capabilities.

136929.name: Ekimae Taxi
136929.description: Number 9 (of 12) in the Epoch Manga game series. Bookshelf game based on the comic strips of Fujio Akatsuka. All movement is spin and move. Each player controls a taxi and picks up fares from the train station. Destination and fare collected is determined by a card draw. Opposing players can move police cars when they land on a police icon to impede other players and force them to draw an event card. Event cards are generally misfortunes, but there are occasional good events (tipping customer, a bonus fare, etc). The winner is the player with the most fares collected once the are deck is exhausted. Art on the board, pieces, and cards are a mish mash of characters from Fujio Akatsuka comics.

136930.name: PlayStation 3 Super Slim
136930.description:
In September 2012, Sony announced that a new slimmer PS3 redesign (CECH-4000) was due to be released in late 2012 and that it would be available with either a 250 GB or 500 GB hard drive.

In PAL regions, the 250 GB model is not available; a model with 12 GB of flash memory (CECH-4000A) is available in its place. A standalone 250 GB hard drive (CECH-ZHD1) is available to upgrade this model. In the UK, the 500 GB model was released on September 28, 2012, while the 12 GB model was made available on October 12, 2012.

CECH-4000B consoles (those with hard drives) weigh approximately 2.1 kg (4.6 lb), while the CECH-4000A weighs approximately 2.0 kg (4.4 lb). Both are ≈25% smaller and ≈20% lighter than the original PS3 Slim. This version has a sliding disc cover rather than the slot-loading drive found on previous PlayStation 3 consoles.

Source: Wikipedia, "PlayStation 3", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

136931.name: Hundreds
videogamehonor: 2012 IGF Awards Best Mobile Game of the Year Nominee
2013 IGF Awards Excellence In Visual Art Nominee
136931.description:
Hundreds is a puzzle game about space.
The space between you and the serene.
It's simple.

To win: tap & grow floating bubbles until they add to 100.

Source: The Game Website.

136932.name: Kewpie Doll Game
136932.description:
Simple move game for young players. (4-8)
Don't let the little mermaid die of sadness. She is stuck at low tide. Help her find her way through the castle to safety. From Alvin's Vintage Boardgames.

136934.name: Whiskey Gulch
136934.description:
In Whiskey Gulch, players compete with each other to accumulate resources and money in the post-Civil War American West. Each player controls a family that is attempting to increase their holdings through worker placement, politics, and violence. Players interact with each other and the harsh environment of the West in an attempt to become the most powerful family in the town of Whiskey Gulch.

Each turn begins with an Event Card that affects all players. Players then select two action cards and place their workers on their holdings. Then each player reveals an Environment Card that affects them specifically. Actions are then carried out and combat is resolved. To end the turn players gather resources from their property.

Whiskey Gulch has 3 ages that each last 8 turns. Scoring is based on a combination of money, resources, political offices held, and buildings constructed at game end. There are many paths to victory, but only one winner.

Whiskey Gulch is in post production. Release in Q2 2013

136935.name: District 187: Sin Streets
136935.description:
District 187: Sin Streets is a first-person shooter video game developed by Netmarble, a subsidiary of CJ Corporation. An online multiplayer, the game pits SWAT teams and gangsters against each other in urban combat.

The game resembles Counter-Strike, including its "cops and robbers" setup, game modes and map layouts. It features an extensive weapon modification system that allows both mechanic and cosmetic upgrades. The game focuses on clans and team-based progression. Clans will compete for territory, with clan performance in four weekly "street fight" events determining possession of city districts.

District 187 is free-to-play, with all weapons available for in-game currency only. Players are charged real money for cosmetic modifications and for upgrades that speed up the acquisition of in-game currency.

Source: Wikipedia, "District 187: Sin Streets", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

136937.name: Aristozzle
136937.description:
A classic game of happy families with a twist, comprising 7 aristocratic animals, each attired in the sartorial splendour of the Victorian era. An exciting game for all the family.

Contents : 42 cards wich combined together, create the seven "Aristo" characters :
- Dog, Cat, Hare, Ferret, Giraffe and Wolf.
Each character is divided into six parts, which when reconstitued forms the word A-R-I-S-T-O.

The seven "Aristo-Animals" come together to form the Aristo'zzle, a tableau in the manner of a jigsaw puzzle.

From 2 players to 6.
Minimum age 4 years old.

136938.name: Caesar's Day Off
136938.description:
User Summary

Ceasar's Day Off was developed by Benedikt Hummel, Marius Fietzek and Sabrina Winter as part of IndieSpeedRun 2012 GameJam in 48 hours.

It is a very minimalistic game in which you take the role of Caesar and must approve or disapprove certain activities by giving thumbs up or thumbs down.

136939.name: Biathlon: Eine Leidenschaft – Ein Ziel
136939.description:
A biathlon-themed roll-and-move trivia game with a dexterity component.

Aim of the game: Be the first to complete the course on the board three times.

How it is played:
Players take turns rolling the two dice. If their pawn is on a ascending slope space at the beginning of their turn, they roll only one die. They move their pawn according to the die roll.
If it lands on a grey space, nothing happens. If it lands on a green space, an action card is drawn and the action performed (move pawn backwards/forwards a certain number of spaces, lose a turn etc.).
If it lands on a yellow space, a question card is drawn and the active player has to answer a biathlon-related question. If they succeed, their pawn advances five spaces. If they fail, they go back five spaces.
If the pawn lands on a blue space, they have to go back to start.
If a player rolls the same number on both dice, they gain a fan token, which grants them extra movement in round three.
Since the game is about biathlon, there is also a shooting exercise that takes place after rounds one and two: Players have to hit a target with a wooden marble, using a wooden catapult. Generally, each player has five shots per round to hit the five targets, but shooting cards may allow them to reload. Each missed target means extra spaces to complete in a penalty round.

136941.name: Coaster Crazy
136941.description:
This astonishing new rollercoaster game invites you to journey around the world (and to the moon) to build a coaster empire. Coasters! Pandas! Zombies! Cheerleaders! Explosions! What’s not to like?!

Source: The Developer Website.

136942.name: Era of Sail
136942.description:
Era of Sail, a mobile game proudly developed by DreaminGame, unveils the oceanic mystique through its scenic grandeur, graphical fineness and a pleasant soundtrack set amid Medieval times. Explore the unfathomable depth, build a business empire offshore, and create an ageless seafaring legend of your own!

Source: The Developer Website.

136943.description:
HOLD THE LINE now looks at one of the most fabled conflicts in history, the Jacobite rebellions, in HIGHLAND CHARGE. These uprisings were, as of 2013, the last battles fought on British soil. Featured here are four battles from the fearsome contest: Sheriffmuir, Prestonpans, Falkirk, and Culloden. Worthington is also offering the Killiecrankie scenario free to download. The game closely aligns with the Hold the Line system, but includes rules for Highland charges, Scottish militia, and of course the feared Highland clan units.

James II lost his throne in 1689, but he and his supporters did not give the fight to reclaim his rights and titles. From 1689 to 1745 no less than four major Jacobite rebellions broke out in the Scottish highlands, often with limited aid from France and Spain. The battles were the last hurrah for a dying way of war. The Highlanders relied on assault tactics, in particular the feared Highland charge. The Loyalists, made up of British regulars and Scottish militia, used the linear tactics of the day, including volley fire, artillery barrages, and bayonets. For a time the Highlanders seemed to be tactically superior until the shattering defeat at Culloden, a battle that proved the ultimate superiority of musket and artillery fire over the claymore.

As the Jacobites can you reclaim the throne for the Stuart dynasty? As the Loyalists can you protect the Hanoverian succession and deal a final death blow to absolutism in Britain? Across the way the bagpipes can be heard. The clans have mustered, the sound of cannon deafens, men shout commands, smoke fills the air. You must HOLD THE LINE!
136943.name: Hold the Line: Highland Charge

videogame: Zork I: The Great Underground Empire
Zork II: The Wizard of Frobozz
136944.name: The Lost Treasures of Infocom (iOS)
videogamecompilation: Zork I: The Great Underground Empire
Zork II: The Wizard of Frobozz
136944.description:
User Summary

A collection of 27 classic Infocom text adventure games.

Included with the games or for download purchase are:

2D and 3D scans of the original boxes, instruction booklets, maps and novelty items.
The original InvisiClues. Users can swipe the screen revealing hints to help them on their text adventures.
Scan of the 1984 catalog: "The Complete Works of Infocom, Inc.".




Contains all of the games from the The Lost Treasures of Infocom collection except:

Zork Zero: The Revenge of Megaboz
Beyond Zork: The Coconut of Quendor
The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy




Contains all of the games from the The Lost Treasures of Infocom II collection except:

Arthur: The Quest for Excalibur
Bureaucracy
James Clavell's Shōgun
Journey: The Quest Begins
Nord and Bert Couldn't Make Head or Tail of It
Sherlock: The Riddle of the Crown Jewels




Contains the following that were in neither of the above Infocom collections:

Leather Goddesses of Phobos
Zork: The Undiscovered Underground

136945.name: Highway Underpass
136945.description:
From the Introduction:

Two small highways, with two lanes in either direction, cross each other here. One of them descending into an artificial valley to pass underneath the solid concrete bridge of the other. While solid concrete dividers separate the lanes going into different directions the outer lanes are only flanked by the grass covered slope of the small valley or aluminium crash barriers respectively. More notably is probably that both highways are flanked by street lamps in regular intervals, providing the streets with moderate illumination even in the darkest of nights, which suggests that these highways are crossing in an urban area.

136946.name: R-Type Leo
136946.description:
Released only in arcades, R-Type Leo deviates from the normal R-Type style by removing the use of both the Force and the Wave Cannon. The new weapons are Force Bits (later identified in R-Type Final as "Psy Bits") which carry similar firepower to the main ship. The ship weapons are:

Red - Claw Laser - a powerful horizontal laser beam and horizontal traverse wave
Blue - Mirror Laser - fires multiple, ricocheting lasers.
Green - Search Laser LRG - fires semi-homing lasers that can bend at 90° angles.

Unlike previous Bit Devices, the Psy Bits are capable of firing forward or backwards (the direction is controlled by movement of the ship itself). Finally, the Wave Cannon is replaced by a "Bit Shot", where the Psy Bits detach from the ship and collide with the nearest enemy at high velocity. The Bits can only do this for so long before running out of energy, and must be recalled to the ship to recharge.

R-Type Leo is much more forgiving than its predecessors because if a player dies, the ship will immediately return instead of starting at the beginning of the level or checkpoint. If the ship has Psy Bits when he died, a laser crystal will be dropped and the player can get his psy bits (but not their weapon) back.

R Type Leo is the first game in the series to allow 2 players to play simultaneously.

Source: Wikipedia, "R-Type Leo", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

136948.name: Truth & Talismans
136948.description:
From the back cover:

No fantasy gamer can ever have enough new spells or magic items. This book enriches any First or Second Edition Advanced Fantasy Roleplaying campaign by presenting dozens of spells, wondrous items, mystical objects, incantations, and fabulous artifacts from far-flung realms. All told, in this book you will find over 70 exciting magic items, 40 spells, and one new character sub-class.

136950.name: Galactic Merchants
136950.description:
Explore the galaxy! Avoid Space Pirates! Move through Worm Holes! Watch out for Asteroids! Oh, and while you're at it, trade for resources and deliver them to the planets that need them.

Each Player is an independent space merchant captain jetting around the galaxy trying to collect resources to fill orders. There are 6 planets that need different resources, but each planet only sells one resource. Fill orders to make money and earn victory points. Once an order is filled, the planet has a new order. Earn additional victory points by exploring the board, but beware! The Galaxy is full of asteroids, worm holes and pirates that can will stand in your way.

The player with the most victory points at the end of the game wins!

The hex board is set up randomly for each game, so exploring the board is part of the fun! No two games will play quite the same. Who is the best space explorer and merchant captain?

136951.name: Pixel Quest
136951.description:
Pixel Quest its a cooperative card game for 1 to 4 players, based on classic 8-bit RPGs. In this adventure game you will play as a party of heroes, travelling around to complete different quests. You’ll get an objective card at the start of the game: once the quests in it are complete, you’ll fight the final Boss. If you defeat him you’ll have won the game.

For each quest, you need to build a deck so your group of heroes can explore it. During these adventures the heroes will fight dangerous monsters, avoid deadly traps and find priceless treasures. But there is more than adventure in a hero’s life – they’ll also get rest at inns, drink at taverns and buy objects that will help them in future quests.

The greatest 8-bit RPG of all times, and you will not be playing it on a video game console, but on a table. Do you dare?

136952.name: poco a poco
136952.description:
User Summary

The board game "poco a poco" is an excellent musical educational tool for any piano instructor. It is extremely versatile and can be used to facilitate learning in both group piano lessons and one-on-one piano lessons. It can be easily adapted for many or as few as two players, and the written board game "rules" are meant to broken if the needs of the class require the piano instructor to do so! The piano instructor must have these following items to actually play "poco a poco" successfully in conjunction with the board game itself: "one piano, metronome, basic technique, sight reading and ear training books/materials, manuscript paper or white board, and [little candies] or other treats." (Poco A Poco Game Rules, p. 1 poco a poco productions 1996)

Game play
Players or teams each roll die to move around the "keyboard" board, answering musical technique or term trivia and performing musical exercises in the varying categories required. Points or candies are awarded to players or teams who have completed their trivia or exercises successfully. The player or team who has the most points or candies is declared the winner.

Only a few hundred copies were produced and sold locally. Production ceased when the designers diverged.

136953.name: Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire (GBA/DS)
videogameversion: North American Game Boy Advance edition
136953.description:
Box Back from the Australian Nintendo DS edition

Can You Master The Magic?

Experience the excitement of the movie when you play as Harry, Ron, & Hermione in a breathtaking adventure packed with action and magic.

Cast spells using your stylus as a wand.

Care for your own magical creature.

Dual against other in 2-player wizard dueling mode.

Compete in the Tri-Wizard tournament mini-game.

boardgamehonor: 2013 UK Games Expo Best Boardgame Nominee
136954.description:
Game description from the publisher:

"Finishing races is important, but racing is more important." – Dale Earnhardt

Do you feel the need for speed? If so, Road Rally USA has you covered! Simply pressing the accelerator is not enough, as you must be efficient, managing your fuel and coming in first at your optimal checkpoints to maximize your score. Thus, you need to race and maneuver to be in the proper position when scoring your checkpoints.

Try as you might, it's impossible to maintain the lead throughout the race – and truth be told, while being first at the end of the race helps, placing first at your scoring locations is even more important. Every turn someone could trigger a scoring point. Where will you be as you and your opponents control which checkpoints will score and which get bypassed?

Each racer plays from identical draw decks, playing multiple cards of the same color to provide a boost of speed. Beware as you may reshuffle your deck only at gas stations along the way, and when your hand or draw pile are depleted, you are in for trouble. Race smart and bring home the gold!
136954.name: Road Rally USA
boardgamepodcastepisode: OBG 106: Ever Increasing Quality

boardgamehonor: 2016 Golden Geek Best 2-Player Board Game Nominee
2016 Golden Geek Best Wargame Nominee
136955.description:
Hands in the Sea is a two-player deck building wargame on the First Punic War, between Rome and Carthage, 264–241 BC.

Each player has a starting deck of cards they use to perform various actions, up to two per round. Actions range from colonization, to naval movement, to battle, with most activity centered in and around Sicily and Sardinia/Corsica. Players may also purchase additional cards from their own custom decks, or from a set of neutral cards that either player may purchase. There are also Strategy cards that each player can purchase (one, max) that give the owning player some special advantage.

The game is played over the course of several turns, up to a maximum of twelve. At the end of each turn, players resolve random events, collect income and score victory points. There are several paths to victory, ranging from simply having the highest score at the end of the game, to capturing the opposing player's capital.

Inspired by A Few Acres of Snow, this game features several new elements, including navies, naval battles, cavalry superiority, mercenaries, field battles, sieges, manpower, strategy cards, random events, turn based scoring, bribery and tactical bonuses.

The name of the game is based on a quote from a Carthaginian commander, who claimed at the outbreak of hostilities that the Carthaginian control of the seas was such that the Romans would not even dare wash their hands in the sea.
136955.name: Hands in the Sea
boardgamepodcastepisode: Ep 018 – I, Geek interviews Don Lloyd
Podblast: Dan Berger – Hands in the Sea
WDYPTW Podcast Thing Week 4 12/8/14-12/14/14
What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing

136956.name: Rocksmith Real Tone Cable
136956.description:
User Summary

The Real Tone Cable is a means of connecting a guitar or bass with a standard 1/4" jack into the USB port of a PlayStation 3, Xbox 360, or Windows PC.

This cable was sold both as a bundle with the various versions of Rocksmith, as well as a separate unit. The cable is the same across all supported platforms.

136957.name: Imazine (Issue 22 - Spring 1995)
rpgissuearticle: Once Upon a Time in China
136957.description:
Table of Contents
PSEUDONYMS Role-playing or Deceit? .................2
REVIEWS The New Wave and Magazines .................4
ONCE UPON A TIME IN CHINA The Water Margin Systems .7
CULTURE GAMES Or, What Happened To Worlds? ........10
NOTES Production and Distribution .................13

136958.name: 30 Secondes pour répondre
136958.description:
In his turn player has 30 seconds to answer questions in various topics. With each correct answer player advances 1 step on the track with his pawn.
Player who finishes first is the winner.

136959.name: Labyrinthe en damiers
136959.description:
The objective is to reach opponent side of the game board diagonally first by playing maze-tiles and moving his pawn.
In turn, player rolls the dice.
If player rolls even numbers 2,4,6: He may advances his pawn two squares and can place or rotate a tile.
If player rolls odd numbers 1,3,5: He may place a tile and turn a tile.

136960.description: Based on the same game concept as London: The Board Game, Wien! is a simple family game that lets the players explore the city, discovering the history of the Austrian capital. The board is divided into two areas: the city map and the Timeline. Moving on the city map, the players reach the most famous locations in town and collect historical cards that can then be played to advance on the Timeline. The first player to complete the path on the Timeline wins. Specific knowledge of the history of the town is not required to play the game because Wien! is not a trivia game.
136960.name: Wien!

136961.name: Sidéral
136961.description:
Both player has equal number of Satellites on the game board.
In his turn player rolls the dice and moves his rocket on the game board. If he landed on opponent´s Satellite he takes it over and turns around his color face-up.
Player who owns all the satellites wins the game.

136962.name: Polimi Timeline
136962.description: Based on the same game concept used in London: The Board Game, Polimi Timeline is dedicated to celebrating the 150th anniversary of the Politecnico di Milano (a.k.a. "Polimi"), one of the most prestigious Italian universities. Moving on a map representing the most important locations built or renovated by the architects who graduated at the Polimi, the players collect cards than can then be played to advance on the Timeline, discovering the history of the University. The first player to complete the path on the Timeline wins.

136963.name: The Blessing of St Agnes
136963.description:
Publisher blurb:

The young daughter of a wealthy merchant has vanished, leaving him distraught and pleading for assistance. In the depths of the dark woods beyond the bounds of the town, the ruinous remains of a chapel to St Agnes hide more than a few secrets of a forgotten sisterhood and hope for the helpless.

The Blessing of St Agnes is a system-free adventure for fantasy or historical games (with a healthy dose of the supernatural). As well as a 24-page adventure, the adventure includes two copies of a map of the chapel, with and without room titles.

136964.name: Horrible Histories: Awful Egyptians
136964.description: Based on the popular TV show "Horrible Histories", Awful Egyptians is set in ancient Egypt. The players are "rotten robbers" who try to steal the treasures of the dead Pharaoh hidden in the Pyramid in order to sell them to the rich men in the villages and the unlawful priests in the temples.

136965.name: Ziegenbock
136965.description:
Objective: Be the first moving all your meeples into opposite corner (Halma variant for two on a small board)
- moving by turns -
Playing equipment consists of a checkered board, divided into 7 x 7 squares. Pieces are typically red and blue; in two opposite corners of the board there are thirteen squares - starting area.
Move your meeples according to the rules of Halma.
Remarks:
Published in the 1950's

136966.name: Aero Dancing i
136966.description:
Aero Dancing i, the third game in the AeroWings series, was only released in Japan. The "i" stands for Internet, as it was the first title of the series with an online mode. It was also the first in the series to offer air-to-ground combat missions.

AeroWings (Aero Dancing in Japan) is considered by its fans to be the first true attempt at combat flight simulation on consoles. Contrary to the arcade-oriented "Ace Combat" series, AeroWings provides fairly accurate flight physics, 3D cockpit views, refueling and real weapons loads. Taking off from and landing at airbases and carriers is also simulated. A replay video system is able to record your entire flight and allows you to create your own movie with more than 30 different cameras.

Source: Wikipedia, "AeroWings (series)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

136967.name: Data Annex
136967.description:
Subtitle: "Ships, Subs, Aircraft, Weapons and Electronic Data."

The heart of the Harpoon modern war game is its information-packed DATA ANNEX. This is the fully revised 1990-91 edition, edited and updated by Harpoon designer Larry Bond.

The latest intelligence on naval weaponry- statistics, data and details that define the ships, subs, aircraft, electronics and weapons of the world's modern navies. Includes new aircraft endurance rules and brings earlier editions of the core game up to version 3.2.

136969.name: Commodore Datassette
136969.description:
User summary:
Details from: Wikipedia, "Commodore Datasette", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

The Commodore Datassette (sometimes spelled Datasette) was the standard loading peripheral for the VIC-20 and the C64/128, and was always delivered together with the home computer in question.

The tape head was sensitive and varied between models, so the ?Load Error error when checksums didn't match up was a very common problem for all these machines. The tape head could be adjusted, but on earlier models was a hazzle with opening up the chassi and experimenting. Later models came with a pre-drilled hole to apply a screwdriver to, and third-party manufacturers applied a small screw and some LED-lights to imply signal quality.

136970.name: Quizz'N Cook
136970.description:
This is a Trivia game with questions about the kitchen. All questions have multiple choices.
Draw a card and ask! Who answers correctly scores a point.
Who has the most points is the winner.

200 cards, 13 topics: general culture, culinary knowledge, world cuisine, quotes, riddles recipes, fruits & vegetables, cheeses, confectionery, chocolate, wine & cocktails, coffee, tea, etc.

136971.name: Quizz'N Cook Spécial Chocolat
136971.description:
200 additional questions for Quizz'N Cook about chocolates.

This is a Trivia game with questions about the kitchen. All questions have multiple choices.
Draw a card and ask! Who answers correctly scores a point.
Who has the most points is the winner.

136972.name: Quizz'N Cook Spécial Vin
136972.description:
200 additional questions for Quizz'N Cook about wines.

This is a Trivia game with questions about the kitchen. All questions have multiple choices.
Draw a card and ask! Who answers correctly scores a point.
Who has the most points is the winner.

136973.name: Quizz'N Cook spécial apéro
136973.description:
200 additional questions for Quizz'N Cook about drinks.

This is a Trivia game with questions about the kitchen. All questions have multiple choices.
Draw a card and ask! Who answers correctly scores a point.
Who has the most points is the winner.

136975.name: Cyvasse
boardgamefamily: A Song of Ice and Fire
136975.description:
Cyvasse is a two-player strategy board game, featured in George R.R. Martin’s “A Song of Ice and Fire” series.

  Cyvasse features ten types of “unit” (King, Dragon, Elephant, Trebuchet, Catapult, Heavy Horse, Light Horse, Crossbowman, Spearman and Rabble) with different powers and attributes and capture conditions.
In addition, the board includes individual "Mountain" and "Fortress" tiles, allowing for a different battlefield terrain each game
Before play, each player arranges their half of the board secretly, placing units and terrain tiles under cover of a large dividing screen. Once arranged, the screen is removed and play proceeds in alternating turns. Each piece has its own strengths and weaknesses, and multiple units (such as Elephants and Spearmen) may be moved during a single turn.
The game ends upon the capture of an opposing player’s King.

Cyvasse combines the simple elegance of chess with elements reminiscent "Stratego" and "Blitzkrieg".

The following material represents an amalgamation of the better fan-published material found online coupled with my own ideas.  It is hoped that the following interpretation provides a balanced, interesting and (above all) fun Cyvasse experience while keeping as close as possible to the descriptions presented in the novels.

136976.name: Table Skittles
136976.description: Table Skittles is like bowling but the ball is attached to a chain which is swung in the air and makes no ground contact. Players take turns throwing the ball in a clockwise direction around the pole to knock down the pins. There are many different variants and rules because of the games age but the main game rule version played is the first player to knock down exactly 101 pins wins the game.

136977.name: Ruckus Deadly 60
136977.description:
A speed game of card matching.

Opponents race to get rid of the cards in their hands by matching identical types of deadly animals. Once a match is made it is laid face up in front of you. Opponents will 'steal' the tricks in front of you if they have a matching card. The first person to lose all their cards shouts "Deadly Ruckus!", and gets a 5 point bonus for going out first. All players then gain 1 point for each card in front of them, and minus 1 for each card in their hand.

The process of stealing tricks from other players if you have a single matching card gives the game something of a fatal flaw in that slower players gain more cards in front of them.

136978.name: Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix (GBA/DS)
videogameversion: North American Game Boy Advance edition
136978.description:
User Summary

Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix for the DS and GBA is a action adventure game based of the movie of the same name. The DS and GBA versions of this game allow you roam around a pre-rendered 3D model of Hogwarts while completing mini-games over the course of the story.

136979.name: TAC-2
136979.description:
User summary:

The TAC 2 (acronym for Totally accurate controller) was released in the mid 80s and was one of the most heavily used joysticks during the 80s era of gaming. It used a standard 9 pin "atari" connector, which made it compatible with all Atari machines, the VIC-20, C64 and Amiga. It was a ditigal 8-way control stick with 1 button.

The TAC-2 was famous for being next to unbreakable. Indeed its design was extremely simplistic, with the joystick simply being a metal pin that connected to metal plates, short-cirtuiting a connection to.

Despite its apparent look of having 2 buttons, they connected to the same button.

It came in black and white.

136980.name: Wico Command Control Bat Handle Joystick
136980.description:
User summary:

The Wico Bathandle, together with the Wico Redball, were widely used joystick controllers during the 80s era of gaming. They were both soft-response digital controllers with one button, but selectable if it should be the stick base button or the one on top of the handle.

At the time, they were slightly more expensive than the commonly used TAC-2 and its siblings, and was therefore regarded as a luxury item.

136981.name: Wico Command Control Red Ball
136981.description:
User summary:

The Wico Redball, together with the Wico Bathandle, were widely used joystick controllers during the 80s era of gaming. They were both soft-response digital controllers with one button, but selectable if it should be the stick base button or the one on top of the handle.

At the time, they were slightly more expensive than the commonly used TAC-2 and its siblings, and was therefore regarded as a luxury item.

136982.name: Slik Stik
136982.description:
User summary:

The Slik Stik was a smaller sibling to the widely popular joystick TAC-2 from the same manufacturer. It had a very similar design but was smaller and the base could quite easily be gripped in one hand. Also, the button had only 1 placement making it rather unfit for left-handed gamers.

Just like the TAC-2, the Slik Stik was simply a metal pin that touched metal plates, and the spring that pulled it back into center position was a bit of rubber. The connectors were very close to the stick, so it had to be merely touched a bit to connect, making the Slik Stik an ideal controller for "wiggle" games where the goal was to wiggle the joystick back and forth quickly.

136983.name: StarFighter Joystick
136983.description:
User summary:

The StarFighter Joystick was a smaller sibling to the widely popular joystick TAC-2 from the same manufacturer. In all aspects except the design of the very stick, it was similar to the equally smaller sibling "Slik Stik", also by the same manufacturer; the Slik Stik had a pin with a ball on it, the Starfighter was merely a stick. Like the Slik-Stik, it had only 1 button.

136984.name: Was ist Was: Das große Quiz
136984.description:
Was ist Was: Das große Quiz is a combination board game/app facilitator, with players trying to answer questions on topics ranging from nature, wildlife and art to geography, history and culture. On a turn, the active player rolls a die and moves on the game board to see which topic she'll be quizzed on. Some locations show a bonus space, in which all players compete in one of five different app games, with the winner being the one who first:


Recognizes the correct animal.
Identifies the right sound.
Determines which animal is heavier, which building is taller, or which vehicle is faster.
Knows where to find a particular country.
Excavates a dinosaur first.


(If you're playing without the app, the active player chooses one of the topics for the bonus question presented to all players.)

136985.name: PlayStation Multitap
136985.description:
User summary:

The official multitap for the Playstation (whether this specific version also works with PS2 is unknown). It allows for 4 controllers and 4 memory cards to be connected to one single controller port.

136986.description:
Legends of Andor: The Star Shield, dubbed the first expansion for Legends of Andor, presents the player heroes with new tasks they must now face. After defeating the dragon, the heroes go in search of the star shield – the great power of which could prove to be both a blessing and a curse should it fall into the wrong hands.

To make matters even worse, hungry wolves have been sighted during their journey, but if the players succeed in taming the alpha wolf, the wolf pack will become faithful companions in their fight against a resurgent evil.

Box Contents:

1 Siege tower, 1 Catapult, 1 Dark temple (the middle section needs to be taken from the Base game), 3 Forest mushrooms
1 Water Monster, 1 Krahder, 2 Trolls, 1 Fire Spirit, 3 Wolves
1 Horned Falcon, 1 Torch, 1 Star Shield, 1 Flute, 1 Hourglass, 1 Wolf Symbol, 5 Tree trunks, 8 Fire tokens, 7 Light tokens, 1 Key, 1 Star
1 Merrik, the Cartographer; 1 Ken Dorr, the Thief;
1 red "X", 1 marker ring
1 Instruction booklet
3 plastic bags
36 cards:
-- 19 Legend cards (1x A1, 5x A2, 5x A3, 1x A4, 1x C, 1x E, 4x G and 1x N)
-- 6 Tasks/Dangers
-- 1 Gifts of the Andori
-- 5 Hint cards
-- 3 Wolf cards
-- 1 Varkur's Triumph card
-- 1 Starlight card
136986.name: Legends of Andor: The Star Shield

136987.name: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince (DS/PSP)
videogamehonor: 2010 British Academy Game Awards Best Soundtrack of the Year Nominee
136987.description:
North American DS Box Back

Summon the Wizard Within You!

Explore Harry's world and choose how you play.

Mix potions, discover hidden items and play mini-games.

Uncover the truth to piece together Voldermort's past.

136988.name: Sega Saturn Controller
136988.description:
User summary:

The controllers used with the Sega Saturn. It came fist in black only, then in several colours; white with the white saturn, gray for the V-saturn and transparent for the Skeleton Saturn.

136989.name: Sega Saturn 6 Player Adaptor
136989.description:
User summary:

The Multitap for the Sega Saturn differed from others in that it let not 4, but 6 extra controllers in one port.

136990.name: Trance Vibrator
136990.description:
User summary:

The Trance Vibrator was a USB-powered vibrator that was sold together with the Playstation 2 release of the psychedelic rail-shooter REZ.

Its only function is that it will vibrate together with the rhythm, just like the controller does (but with a different rhythm).

Due to its name, shape and funtion, jokes on "how to use" are many, and some consider it to be the most hilarious game peripheral ever.

boardgamehonor: 2015 As d'Or - Jeu de l'Année Nominee
2015 Golden Geek Best Family Board Game Nominee
2015 Golden Geek Best Party Board Game Nominee
2015 Spiel der Spiele Hit für Familien Recommended
2015 Spiel des Jahres Recommended
2015 Tric Trac Nominee
136991.description:
In the wonderful land of Arkadia, a very old king has no heir. He organizes a tournament to offer his throne to the bravest adventurer of the kingdom. Up to five finalists will wander seven worlds full of surprises...

In the drawing game Loony Quest, players study challenging level cards, then try to replicate the outline to meet targets and avoid obstacles on their tracing sheets. Once finished, players place their sheets on top of the level card to see whether the drawings line up with the targets they meant to hit — or avoid. Largely inspired by video games, Loony Quest players discover various worlds, play with 3D and 2D levels, run into loony monsters — Loonies — and big bosses, trigger special stages, collect bonuses, use penalties on opponents, and gather as many Xperience points as possible to win.

Loony Quest features the same basic gameplay as in Doodle Quest, but has been developed differently by the publisher.
136991.name: Loony Quest
boardgamepodcastepisode: Ep. 21 – Spiel des Jahres Trivia & Predictions | Podcast of Nonsensical Gamers
Episode 15: Survive: Escape from Atlantis!, Trading Places, and Cardinal Quest
ET91: Eso no es un Podcast, da la vuelta Chewie!
HLG 11: Stilte voor de Storm
Loony Quest (Libellud): Spiele-Podcast Nr. 267
MOBG 27 On a Loony Quest to find some Legendary Metal Coins
RJ45: Barcelona meets Cannes
The Game Pit: Episode 31 - Essen 2014 Treasure Hunt Special (part 1)
The Game Pit: Episode 44 - Lobstercon
Trees are the answer! - Episode 24

136992.name: Versteck dich, kleine Schnecke!
136992.description: Notwithstanding the title of this game – Versteck dich, kleine Schnecke! – the snail will not hide itself, but will instead need help from at least one of the players. Playable either indoors and out, this game of hide and seek has one player turning over a color chip, then hiding the game's snail in a location matching this color. The other players then work together to hunt down the snail, or chase it down individually to find it, salt it, and take a bite in triumph before anyone else can get their hands on it.

136993.name: Strike Suit Zero
136993.description:
User Summary

In Strike Suit Zero, you'll pilot one of four transforming upgrade-able ships into hordes of enemies, including fighters and large capital ships which you'll have to target piece by piece.

The game supports multiple screens and features multiple endings.

136994.name: Der will nur spielen! Das Familienspiel
136994.description:
In Der will nur Spielen! Das Familienspiel, players compete in a wide variety of categories, each testing their animal knowledge or reflexes in varied ways. Who has a good reaction time when retrieving something? Who can remember the most signals? Who can dig out a bone hidden in a bed of roses? Who knows the favorite breeds of the other players? And who can show off her knowledge of dog breeds by answering questions?

For all of these activities and more, players are rewarded with bones when they do well, and whoever first collects twenty bones in her basket wins!

136995.name: Produto
136995.description:
from the designer:

"The basic idea is simple: players take turns placing stones on a board, forming groups. When the board is full, each players calculates the product of the sizes of his two largest groups. Whoever has the larger number wins."

136996.name: Matter of Fact
boardgameversion: Game Development Group English First Edition
136996.description: A Real Trivia Challenge! Matter of Fact is perfect for those who know a lot - or think they do... Every game card has seven questions for you to answer around a main theme. The more questions you answer correctly, the more spaces you move along the board. Stumble too much and you might even have to move backwards. The Answer Tracker shows how well you’re doing. All subjects are covered in a variety of fun formats: from Claim to Fame, Title Twist, All Mixed Up, and more. Just go down the Question List and see how you do, either on your own or with the help of teammates. It’s trivia with a whole new twist!

136997.name: You'll Never Guess!
boardgameversion: Game Development Group English First Edition
136997.description: YOU'LL NEVER GUESS! (...or will you?) Stimulate your brain, challenge your skills of deduction, and have fun trying to guess what players are up to! Say the Presenter reads out a question like ‘Where Am I?’. It could be Dallas, France, Hawaii or somewhere else. So how will you figure out where they’re pretending to be? By asking them your own questions to narrow down the possibilities. You could ask: ‘Would I take a plane to get there?’, ‘Is it a city?’, ‘Does it have cold winters?’, or anything else you can think of. You decide what to ask. You may also get to roll for a Letter Clue. In another round you might be asked to guess what someone's supposed to be ‘wearing’, ‘eating’, ‘holding’, and much more.

136998.name: Capcom Pad Soldier
136998.description:
User Summary

The Capcom Pad Soldier was a 3rd party controller made by Capcom for the SNES, Genesis, and 3D0. The controller was attempt to better replicate the Street Fighter experience from the arcades on home consoles. It moved all six buttons to the face of the controller. In the SNES's case this moved the L and R buttons next to the other buttons on the face of the controller. Each platform's controller used colors to match their appropriate platform. The Genesis controller was called Capcom Pad Soldier GS. The SNES was just called Capcom Pad Soldier.

137000.name: Madden NFL 2000 (GBC)
videogameversion: North American Game Boy Color edition
137000.description:
User Summary

Madden NFL 2000 on the handheld has exhibition mode, full season and tournament play (saved through a password system), and sudden death mode. Includes the full NFL license and features such as weather, injuries, and a large playbook.
